data.post:
World renowned chef and TV host (Parts Unknown) Anthony Bourdain dead at age 61. One of my favorite shows. He fought inner  demons most of his life and seemed to be in the winning side recently, but finally succumbed to dark thoughts...he committed suicide. 

His TV show illustrated what human interaction could be like if we just cut the shit and approach each other human to human. If we could simply sit down and have a meal and a drink with our fellow human beings without judgement of who they are, what they believe in and what they eat, to find out who they are, what they believe, and why they eat what they eat, the world would likely understand each other better and we would all be better off.

On the issue of mental health, if you suspect, just ask. You might be surprised what you learn. 

RIP Anthony Bourdain, you are free now. 
#AnthonyBourdain #CNN #MentalHealth

comments.comment:
Just sharing for anyone interested. This excerpt comes from time magazine on the origin of memorial day. 

 Yale University historian David Blight places the first Memorial Day in April 1865, when a group of former slaves gathered at a Charleston, S.C., horse track turned Confederate prison where more than 250 Union soldiers had died. Digging up the soldiers' mass grave, they interred the bodies in individual graves, built a 100-yd. fence around them and erected an archway over the entrance bearing the words "Martyrs of the Race Course." On May 1, 1865, some 10,000 black Charleston residents, white missionaries, teachers, schoolchildren and Union troops marched around the Planters' Race Course, singing and carrying armfuls of roses. Gathering in the graveyard, the crowd watched five black preachers recite scripture and a children's choir sing spirituals and "The Star-Spangled Banner." While the story is largely forgotten today, some historians consider the gathering the first Memorial Day.

I believe there is a difference between memorial day and veterans day. Just my opinion though.

My family and I had a wonderful time this weekend at the Filipino Festival (PhilFest 2018) in Tampa. ð¸ð½ I enjoyed the food, music ð¶, culture, and hospitality ðð¼  by the Filipino community. It was a beautiful site ð¤© and am happy my kids got to enjoy that side of their heritage. I am also grateful for my family (Kenzie, Isaac, Eric, and Heather), who showed up and showed their support for my wife, Maginda, and also the Philippine American Chamber of Commerce (PACC), who welcomed me with open arms. Finally, I must confess what I enjoyed most this weekend was watching Maginda enjoy her culture and heritage to the fullest. She smiled and laughed A LOT, which made me smile and laugh A LOT! ð LOL!! I look forward to the next event and also look forward to share my Puerto Rican heritage with them in the future. #MabuhayAngPilipinas ð¸ð½

Amazing, the ignorance of some people. This person is a high school teacher and councilman (major influencer). Here is what he was recorded saying about military members (inside his high school classroom), 

"We've got a bunch of dumb â¦ over there," Salcido says in the recording, using a expletive. "Think about the people who you know who are over there â your freaking stupid Uncle Louie or whatever â they're dumbâ¦. They're not like high-level thinkers, they're not academic people, they're not intellectual people. They're the freaking lowest of our low."

The military is made up of everything from office workers and transportation specialists to scientists and engineers.  Less than 1% of the U.S. population are in the military and fight (within their respective careers) for the other 99% of Americans. Freedom of speech can often reveal ignorance, stupidity, and envy...use wisely. You're welcome Mr. Salcido. #AimHigh

OK, so itâs been a while since Iâve been in FREEZING weather. As Iâm driving LJ to the bus stop this morning, itâs 27 (fu*#^n) degrees outside (in Florida!!), I turn on the wipers and spray a little water like I usually do to clear a smudge on the windshield (as Iâm driving).

Instantly, a thin layer of ice forms on my windshield so I canât see! Wipers are going fast, ice on windshield and the car is moving! So, I do what any other rational person would do...I roll down my window and stick my head out until I get to the bus stop!! Yeah, I looked just like youâre imagining right now.

My immediate thought was âI hope I donât hit anyone walking in the streetsâ and LJ is going to be REALLY embarrassed pulling up at the bus stop w/ his Dad looking like this. But nope, I look over and he has tears in his eyes from laughing so hard at me.

Well, there you have it. After that incident, no caffeine needed this morning...Iâve already had my dose of freezing weather and adrenaline to wake me up, thank you very much! Hope youâre having a better day. Stay warm. #FloridaProblems #WaterBecomesIceBelow32Degrees

media.description:
Not what I was expecting to read on the cover of todayâs paper (last day of the year) âMilitary Suicides Leave Heavy Toll.â 
I spent my fair share of Christmas overseas while on Active Duty, and at times, alone with no family except my military brothers and sisters. Not everyone is prepared to deal with this reality so we have to look out for each other. If you have loved ones in the military, please reach out to them and just let them know youâre thinking about them...that they are NOT alone. Please. Today, military suicide rates are more than double that of our civilian counterparts. 
On a personal note, just yesterday I received a call from one of my military brothers I was stationed with overseas over 20 years ago...he was just checking up on me and letting me know he was thinking of me. He made my day.
#SuicideAwareness #Veterans 
#18002738255

Â¡La portada de la publicaciÃ³n semanal IMPACTO LATINO en la ciudad de Nueva York! Â¡LLeguÃ© a la portada!  Ji Ji #QueEmociÃ³n

Â¡QuÃ© HONOR ser entrevistado por Miriam FernÃ¡ndez SoberÃ³n, destacada periodista por mÃ¡s de 40 aÃ±os. AdemÃ¡s de eso, que la publicaciÃ³n Impacto Latino seleccione su artÃ­culo periodÃ­stico y la presente en su portada es verdaderamente una bendiciÃ³n y un honor. Lo mas importante para mi es que nuestro mensaje de ayudar a reconstruÃ­r PUERTO RICO estÃ¡ aplificÃ¡ndose y la gente lo estÃ¡ escuchando! Impacto Latino es la publicaciÃ³n semanal de habla hispana mÃ¡s antigua de Nueva York y una de las mÃ¡s antiguas de los Estados Unidos. Agradecimientos especiales para Impacto Latino (New York NY) y Minaya Public Relations (Miami FL).

Hay muchas maneras de AYUDAR A RECONSTRUÃ­R PUERTO RICO. Considere algunas posibilidades como la compra de mi nuevo sencillo o camiseta "Puerto Rico Se Levanta", hacerse VOLUNTARIO y ayudar las organizaciones legÃ­timas enviar ayuda a Puerto Rico, Ã³ solo COMPARTIR este mensaje con sus ideas sobre cÃ³mo podemos ayudar a que Puerto Rico se levante nuevamenteâ¦mejor que nunca. Por cierto, si estÃ¡s en Nueva York, me encantarÃ­a una foto de ti con la publicaciÃ³n. Â¡EstÃ¡n en todas partes!   Â¡POR FAVOR y GRACIAS!

#PuertoRicoSeLevanta #IvanMontero

FRONT COVER of Impacto Latino Weekly publication in NYC! I'm in the paper...in NYC!! Full-page story on Page 13. #Excited

What an HONOR to be interviewed by Miriam Fernandez Soberon, a highly respected Latina newspaper reporter for over 40 years. On top of that, for Impacto Latino to select her story on me and feature it on their cover is truly a blessing and honor. Our message for PUERTO RICO is getting out, and most importantly, people are listening! Impacto Latino is the oldest Hispanic weekly publication in New York and one of the oldest in the nation. Thank you to Impacto Latino (NYC) and Minaya Public Relations (Miami FL).

Many ways to HELP PUERTO RICO REBUILD. Please consider the purchase of my new âPuerto Rico Se Levantaâ single or T-Shirt, VOLUNTEER to help legitimate organizations send aid to Puerto Rico, or SHARE this message AND your ideas on how we can help Puerto Rico Rise Again. Two (of many) unlikely heroes to the people of Puerto Rico that emerged during the disaster Hurricanes Maria and Irma left behind on the island. One, a French-Canadian reporter for CBS News David Begnaud, the other a Puerto Rican helicopter pilot with an Italian name, Giovanni Brignoni. Both, reporting beyond political lines and smoke-and-mirrors to bring the refreshing truth, good or bad, to those interested in what's happening on the island. I salute them both. #PuertoRicoSeLevanta #DavidBegnaud #GiovanniBrignoni

media.description:
*** ENGLISH ***
This is the CD cover for my new single, "Puerto Rico Se Levanta" (Puerto Rico will rise again). As promised, I will tell you a little about the photo and why I chose it as the cover...

With the passing of Hurricane MarÃ­a over Puerto Rico came many photos across social media of the devastation that Maria left in her path on the island. Like many on the 'outside' I was in a state of shock looking at photos of total devastation, but it was not until I saw a small series of photos that I was deeply affected. These were pictures of places I knew well in my town where damages would change the landscape forever ... it will never be the same. This photo on the cover of my new single was one of them.

This photo was taken high in the mountains of Utuado, our hometown, just days after the hurricane. Utuado was one of the most affected areas. Looking at this photo I noticed something very special and different from the others. The photos I had seen of devastation also brought anguish, pain, and hopelessness. It was precisely that (hope), which struck me as different in this photo, the FlamboyÃ¡n still standing, leafless, humiliated, and practically left for dead, but still at attention in position just as a good soldier would watching over his town ... with hope of rising again. This is how I see my Puerto Rico. That's how I see my people. Although we were knocked down, we're going to get up.

This image was not captured by a journalist or professional camera. It was captured by my aunt (Wilma RodrÃ­guez de Orama) with her cell phone in front of her house in her front yard. She took advantage of a moment where she managed to connect with her cell phone to let me know she was okay, then she sent me the photo because she knows what it means to me. The day that the photo came in I was already in the studio recording "Puerto Rico Se Levanta." As I showed the photo to my colleagues we all knew, that was the photo that represented our song and HAD to go on the cover.

That FlamboyÃ¡n you see in the photo is the same one my children came to admire, climb, and take âselfiesâ in. They even slid down that hill it overlooks on homemade slides (yagua). Imagine the pride I felt when I saw that the FlamboyÃ¡n, although completely whooped, was still standing. Someday soon it will again flourish. The FlamboyÃ¡n will return like good soldier with a new uniform and with medals on his proud chest representing the scars of what it survived. It will return more great than ever. Our people will do the same ... Puerto Rico Se Levanta! Puerto Rico will rise again! 

Note: Soon, I will give you information about the launch, where 100% of the profits will be sent, and our humble campaign to raise funds. Thank you and God bless us all.

#PuertoRicoSeLevanta

data.post:
*** ENGLISH ***
This is the CD cover for my new single, "Puerto Rico Se Levanta" (Puerto Rico will rise again). As promised, I will tell you a little about the photo and why I chose it as the cover...

With the passing of Hurricane MarÃ­a over Puerto Rico came many photos across social media of the devastation that Maria left in her path on the island. Like many on the 'outside' I was in a state of shock looking at photos of total devastation, but it was not until I saw a small series of photos that I was deeply affected. These were pictures of places I knew well in my town where damages would change the landscape forever ... it will never be the same. This photo on the cover of my new single was one of them.

This photo was taken high in the mountains of Utuado, our hometown, just days after the hurricane. Utuado was one of the most affected areas. Looking at this photo I noticed something very special and different from the others. The photos I had seen of devastation also brought anguish, pain, and hopelessness. It was precisely that (hope), which struck me as different in this photo, the FlamboyÃ¡n still standing, leafless, humiliated, and practically left for dead, but still at attention in position just as a good soldier would watching over his town ... with hope of rising again. This is how I see my Puerto Rico. That's how I see my people. Although we were knocked down, we're going to get up.

This image was not captured by a journalist or professional camera. It was captured by my aunt (Wilma RodrÃ­guez de Orama) with her cell phone in front of her house in her front yard. She took advantage of a moment where she managed to connect with her cell phone to let me know she was okay, then she sent me the photo because she knows what it means to me. The day that the photo came in I was already in the studio recording "Puerto Rico Se Levanta." As I showed the photo to my colleagues we all knew, that was the photo that represented our song and HAD to go on the cover.

That FlamboyÃ¡n you see in the photo is the same one my children came to admire, climb, and take âselfiesâ in. They even slid down that hill it overlooks on homemade slides (yagua). Imagine the pride I felt when I saw that the FlamboyÃ¡n, although completely whooped, was still standing. Someday soon it will again flourish. The FlamboyÃ¡n will return like good soldier with a new uniform and with medals on his proud chest representing the scars of what it survived. It will return more great than ever. Our people will do the same ... Puerto Rico Se Levanta! Puerto Rico will rise again! 

Note: Soon, I will give you information about the launch, where 100% of the profits will be sent, and our humble campaign to raise funds. Thank you and God bless us all.

#PuertoRicoSeLevanta

Les presento la carÃ¡tula de mi nuevo sencillo, âPuerto Rico Se Levanta.â Como prometido, les contarÃ© un poco sobre la foto y porquÃ© luce en la portadaâ¦

Con el pase del huracÃ¡n MarÃ­a en Puerto Rico vÃ­ por los medios sociales muchas fotos de la devastaciÃ³n que MarÃ­a dejÃ³ en su arrastre a la Isla. Â¡Que azotÃ³n! Como muchos desde âafueraâ me encontraba en un estado de shock mirando fotos de la devastaciÃ³n incansablemente hasta que frente a mi llegaron un par de fotos que me impactaronâ¦fuerte. Eran fotos de lugares que yo bien conocÃ­a en mi pueblo donde los daÃ±os cambiarÃ­an el paisaje para siempreâ¦nunca serÃ¡ igual. Ãsta foto en la portada de mi nuevo sencillo fuÃ© una de ellas. 

La foto fuÃ© tomada alto en las montaÃ±as de Utuado, mi pueblo, a solo dÃ­as despuÃ©s del huracÃ¡n. Utuado fuÃ© una de las Ã¡reas mÃ¡s afectadas. Al mirar esta foto notÃ© algo muy especial y diferente a las demÃ¡s. Las fotos que presentaban devastaciÃ³n tambiÃ©n traÃ­an angustia, dolor, y falta de esperanza. Precisamente, eso fuÃ© lo que me impactÃ³ de esta foto, el FlamboyÃ¡n aÃºn de piÃ©, sin hojas, humillado, y achantado, pero todavÃ­a en su puesto como buen soldado vigilando sobre su puebloâ¦con esperanza de volverse a levantar. AsÃ­ veo mi Puerto Rico. Asi veo mi gente. Aunque nos dieron fuerte, nos vamos a levantar. 

La imagen no fuÃ© captada por un periodista ni con cÃ¡mara professional. FuÃ© captada por mi tÃ­a (Wilma RodrÃ­guez de Orama) con su telÃ©fono mÃ³vil frente a su casa en su batey. AprovechÃ³ un momento donde logrÃ³ conectarse con su mÃ³vil para dejarme saber que estaba bien, y me la enviÃ³ porque ella sabe lo que significa para mi. El dÃ­a que me llegÃ³ la foto ya estaba en el estudio grabando âPuerto Rico Se Levanta.â Al enseÃ±arle la foto a mis compaÃ±eros ya todos lo sabÃ­amos, esa era la foto que representaba nuestra canciÃ³n y tenÃ­a que ir en la portada. 

Ese FlamboyÃ¡n que ven en la foto es el mismo donde mis hijos llegaron admirar, subir y retratarse. Hasta llegaron bajar por la jalda que vigila en yagua. ImagÃ­nense el orgullo que sentÃ­ al ver que el FlamboyÃ¡n, aunque completamente desalojado, todavÃ­a estaba de piÃ©. Imaginar que algÃºn dia muy pronto volverÃ¡ a florecer. VolverÃ¡ como buen soldado con uniforme nuevo y con medallas en su orgulloso pecho representando las cicatrices de lo que ha vivido. VolverÃ¡ mas grandioso que nunca. Nuestra gente lo harÃ¡ igualâ¦Â¡Puerto Rico Se Levanta! 

Nota: PrÃ³ximamente, les darÃ© informaciÃ³n sobre el lanzamiento, lo que se harÃ¡ con el 100% de las ganancias de este sencillo, y nuestra humilde campaÃ±a para recaudar fondos. Gracias y que Dios nos bendiga a todos.

#PuertoRicoSeLevanta

Iâve never written anything so passionate. What happened in Puerto Rico last month affected me deeply. I felt helpless from the outside looking in and wanted to help the best way I could, so I put pen to paper, my thoughts flowed, and gave it a shot...with Music. 

This is a song acknowledging we were hit hard, but Boricuas are strong, and united, Puerto Rico will rise again. Working on release date. I will reveal CD Cover (Artwork) for my new single Friday, Oct 27, 2017 at 12:00 p.m. (noon - Miami time) and will tell you the story behind it. #StayTuned #PuertoRicoSeLevanta

I LOVE RADIO!! Here's my (long) story... 

My first time inside a radio station was at the age of 4 or 5, when my father used to take me to watch as his friend, Mario, produced a local community show. Once in a while they would have me record sayings or the radio station slogan, which they would play over the air. I was FASCINATED. 

Growing up, my mother listened to the radio every morning as we prepared for our day and later in the evening to wind down. We listened to the radio more than we watched TV, if you can imagine that. Saturday mornings were RADIO DAYS as we cleaned up (I'm sure many of you can relate LOL). As a teen, I was fascinated with calling radio stations as a contestant and winning prizes. On one occasion, when I went to the radio station to claim the prize I won, I noticed a note written next to my name which read, "great contestant." Apparently, the DJ liked me so much as a contestant, he felt compelled to write a note next to my name, when it wasn't customary to do so. That was my sign...do it! 

As the years passed, I tagged along to the radio station with my Dad's friends. I went from carrying the records from the car to the station and back to selecting which songs to play, to speaking on the air and even play characters on the air (remember that Julio? Ha Ha). Julio Quezada and Freddy Burgos became my radio mentors. I went on to college after high school, where I earned my FCC license at the college radio station (you needed a license to broadcast back then ;-) and I had a very popular radio show (callers, fans and everything else). 

Soon after that, I joined the Air Force and over the next 22 years my only opportunity to do something similar to radio was to DJ at events (in addition to playing in bands). After I retired from the Air Force, I went back to college to finish what I started and the opportunity to be back on the air presented itself...I jumped on it! I LOVED IT!! I felt right at home behind the console. After I graduated college, I left the booth (for now ;-) and focused on recording my own songs, something I always wanted to do. Although I loved singing cover songs (still do), I felt like I wanted to perform in my own voice...en mi voz. 

Fast forward to today, that's what I'm focused on, recording my first full album "En Mi Voz." We have recorded several songs already and are 'in the studio' building En Mi Voz to share with you very soon. In the meantime, I have a single I am releasing within the next week, but I'll use another post for that...I've used this one up. LOL  As you can see, this (throwback) photo triggered great memories for me. Thanks for reading. :-D

data.post:
Today, I worked at the donation center in Tampa FL for Puerto Rico and was impressed. I met, not only Puerto Ricans wanting to help Puerto Rico, but also people from Mexico, Colombia, and many people from Tampa wanting to help as well. I was touched (and exhausted LOL!).

The event was very well organized. This weekend they are expecting MANY more donations so they will need MANY more volunteers. THANK YOU to Alberto Delgado Santiago (my musician and military retiree brother) and my newly found brother-in-arms still on Active Duty with the Air Force, Kelvin Valle for their leadership during these chaotic times for our people. THANK YOU to all who have donated your time and supplies. BTW, please do not bring water in gallons (bottled water only), clothing, and glass containers. 4916 S. Lois Ave, Tampa FL

We have a LONG road to recovery in Puerto Rico, but I feel confident, especially now with the presence of our U.S. Armed Forces on the ground and in the air in PR, that we will rise stronger than ever before. #PuertoRicoSeLevanta ðµð·

status_updates.title: Ivan Montero marked himself safe during Hurricane Irma in Florida after a friend asked if he was okay.

data.post:
WE ARE SAFE. 
Broken branches, plastic fences blown away, and palm trees down in our neighborhood, but it could have been A LOT worse. Our house is intact and we had no water or wind damage (at least at first glance). Shout out to my boys LJ & Ricky for helping me fill up sandbags and setting them up around the house, and to Jr for helping us readjust them mid storm. ðâð¨

My oldest son, Ivan Jr and his family, joined us at our house. We were well prepared for a power outage with food, water, flashlights, and in worse case scenario, our vehicles were gassed up, bags packed, and ready to evacuate. We maintained power throughout the storm and our A/C unit held up. No flooding mainly due to our neighborhood being fairly new and engineered to drain water from the yards to the street, then from the street to a series of retention ponds nearby (that's why you see so many "ponds" in Florida - many are man-made). Also, the power lines in our neighborhood are buried below ground, which greatly minimizes the chance of power outages caused by downed trees and utility poles. 

The wind is still blowing and the skies are moving fast, but the sun is also out. ð Like my Dad always says, "Por oscura que sea la noche, tiene que salir el sol." I thank God for protecting us and pray all those affected in a worse way by this storm and others to come (Harvey, Katia, and now Jose). ðª

I am lucky and blessed to have the best battle-buddy in the world in my wife, Maginda. She had every scenario covered and prepared us for EVERYTHING! She is a warrior. We started our relationship "hunkered down" in my apartment in Okinawa Japan â© during Typhoon Kirk (direct hit w/ 110 mph winds) 20+ years ago, and here we are today, still together and still able to make it through any storm. I am a lucky guy. ð 

THANK YOU for all the calls, messages, texts, thoughts, and prayers. Sending all that love right back at you threefold! â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ Blessings to you all.  "...and now back to our regularly scheduled program..." ð»ðº

media.description:
As the weather forecasters have said from the beginning, the track they show on TV is just a guide; it is a fluid situation (pun intended ð). In Florida, we must ALL take precautions for this storm. 
Everywhere I went today people were talking as if they were professional forecasters. 
The most common phrase I heard today, however, was "We'll be ok...right?" (Facepalm). For my fellow Tampa residents, the general consensus from the professionals is the worst of it will be overnight, Sunday PM to Monday AM. 
We are prepared as much as posible here at our house with enough water, food, batteries, and plenty of SALSA music!!

Wow! Looking through photos on my iPhone...so much happened this summer. Ricky's graduation, concerts, exhibits, visits from my parents/daughters, my brother's return from Germany w/ his fam, amusement parks, switch to new iPhone (that was painful), paint the house interior, had my car broken into (stolen items), DJ a QuinceaÃ±era, got sick (2x), A/C issues (ugh!), cross-country drive w/ my bro (LMFAO!!!), Erie PA visit, spent most time on Air Force Base since 2007 (re-blued?), Ricky's first college days...oh, and going back in the studio to complete my first solo album (Salsa music) in a few weeks. Feeling a bit overwhelmed right now, but will post and share photos/videos as I can. Need to catch my breath and process all this. This whole 'Ricky is in college' thing is like Whoa! :-0  Deeeeeep breath.......HAZAAH!! LOL  Needed to vent a little, we're all family here, right? ð Feel better already.  #Venting. #FatherTimeStopsForNoOne

data.post:
THANK YOU for all the birthday wishes. You guys sure know how to make someone feel special. Much appreciated. ðâ¤ï¸

A very special THANK YOU to my wonderful wife, Maginda, for making my birthday so special. This year she made it possible for my youngest daughter Ariah to make it out here to visit, then made it possible for my oldest daughter Ashlee to be here with her children; all as a birthday gift to me. I got to see my youngest daughter right before my birthday, and on my birthday all my kids (Ashlee, Ivan Jr, Ricky, & Luis) and grandkids (all 5) were with me. What a blessing. Maginda, I love you with everything I've got. Thank you for loving me and for being so supportive. You are a special lady. Last month we celebrated our first 20 years of marriage, we're off to a great start to the next 20. I love you and THANK YOU!

event.name: Rock the Yacht Latin Salsa Party Cruise

data.post:
This Saturday in Tampa FL, I will be joining Orquesta Urbana for a special appearance on the Salsa Party Yacht (Starship). I will be performing my original songs, "YO LA ENAMORE CON SALSA" and "NOS ENTENDEMOS" under the direction of Alberto Cuquito Reyes with Freddie Cruz' Orquesta Urbana and some of the best and well-known musicians in Salsa music today.  

Join us for Salsa, Food, and dancing on a 3-hr cruise around Tampa Bay. We sold out last time...get your tickets before they're gone! You can buy tickets on their website OR on Groupon for a great discount! #RockTheYacht #IvanMontero #OrquestaUrbana #Salsa

status_updates.title: Ivan Montero wrote on Jan-Aileen Duclerc Rodas's timeline.

data.post: I'm an Independent Artist and sadly, I receive these type of scams all the time. "We'll get you played in 500 stations worldwide!" (for a small fee). There are people like this that take advantage of people's dreams to take advantage of them and it's disgusting. I am in the Latin Music industry and IT IS NO DIFFERENT HERE. People try to scam you all the time at every level in the industry. I had one recently from Colombia who claimed to be from a major Latin record label offer to give me FREE studio equipment because they wanted to help up-and-coming Salsa artists...all I had to do was pay a "small shipping fee" to get the equipment to me here in the U.S. Be smart. Do your research. There ARE good people and companies who are willing to help independent artists, but they are hard to find.

data.post: LOL!!! This is sooo me! Ha Ha Ha

We were married 20 YEARS AGO today on the island of Okinawa, Japan. To say that our lives together since that time has been a non-stop adventure would truly be an understatement. OMG!! Through the great times and the not-so-great moments life presented us so far, we figured it out TOGETHER. That has been the key to US...when things got tough, we turned to each other to figure it out (and we've dealt with some crazy sh*t over the years! LOL!!) I LOVE YOU Maginda!!! Thank you for always being YOU, thank you for LOVING me, thank you for SUPPORTING me, thank you for INSPIRING me, and thank you for making me the luckiest man in the world. HAPPY 20th ANNIVERSARY!! #ForeverAndaDay #MiChina

data.post:
SCAM ALERT! 
Received a call from someone in a different area code that I live in, telling me that he was with someone that he believed was my wife, and that she was badly injured in a car accident. He said she gave him my phone number and asked him to call me. Well, my wife was literally standing right in front of me when I received the call, so...I called bullshit on that real quick! It's a scam! I let him have it and he hung up.

The rest of the scam (we didn't get that far) is where they tell you that they're going to hold her hostage until you fork up some money...blah blah blah... I first heard about this scam on the news years ago and also read about it. 

I called the police station to report it and they wouldn't even take a report because "this is so commonplace." People fall for this type of scam ALL THE TIME. Be alert. And IF THIS EVER HAPPENS TO YOU, hang up, then CALL your loved one right away to make sure they're ok. Then, report it to the police (if they'll take your report). Be safe. :-)

media.description:
Had a great time at DULCET last night. 

I couldn't stay long, but what i saw was FENOMENAL! Everyone on and offstage having a good time and the band sounded GREAT! (BTW, @[1632575221:2048:Eric], you ran that sound like the PRO you are). 

Since my Bell's Palsy episode I suffered last year I haven't been out much, so it was nice to see familiar faces @[1412837492:2048:Larry Duran] @[827381161:2048:Martha Delgado], @[1544284915:2048:Edwin Pirulo Reyes] @[1095214594:2048:Benny Maldonado] @[540509029:2048:Kokoand Alis] @[657272742:2048:Nandy Rosario] @[1112140637:2048:Jorge Laureano] @[1192557845:2048:Adger Congatone Antonio] @[1512025682:2048:Edwin Lebron] and so many others. Humbled by your questions and concern regarding my health. My recovery was slow, but steady, and my return to the stage slowly, but surely as well. 

I hope you join us next month (SAT MARCH 11, 2017) at DULCET when I join @[100001280872137:2048:Orquesta Urbana] @[1512025682:2048:Edwin Lebron] and @[716554805:2048:Charlie Hernandez] for a great night of friendship, music, and FUN! 

THANK YOU to @[100002973555649:2048:Johnnie Rivera] for putting this together. Great job! QUE VIVA LA SALSA!!

data.post:
Had a great time at DULCET last night. 

I couldn't stay long, but what i saw was FENOMENAL! Everyone on and offstage having a good time and the band sounded GREAT! (BTW, Eric, you ran that sound like the PRO you are). 

Since my Bell's Palsy episode I suffered last year I haven't been out much, so it was nice to see familiar faces Larry Duran Martha Delgado, Edwin Pirulo Reyes Benny Maldonado Kokoand Alis Nandy Rosario Jorge Laureano Adger Congatone Antonio Edwin Lebron and so many others. Humbled by your questions and concern regarding my health. My recovery was slow, but steady, and my return to the stage slowly, but surely as well. 

I hope you join us next month (SAT MARCH 11, 2017) at DULCET when I join Orquesta Urbana Edwin Lebron and Charlie Hernandez for a great night of friendship, music, and FUN! 

THANK YOU to Johnnie Rivera for putting this together. Great job! QUE VIVA LA SALSA!!

Spent the last two days working on my truck and traded some skin on my knuckles for A LOT of savings in my wallet. 

Two different repair shops said I needed $1400 in repairs.  
- Front upper control arm and ball joint (x2)
- Sway bar link kits and frame bushings
- Rear shocks 
- Labor charges

After watching a bunch of YouTube videos, I thought to myself, "I could do this!" ð So, I bought $285 in parts (shout out to AutoZone and O'Reilley's for military and Uber driver discounts), added $240 worth of tools to my tool set, enlisted the assistance of my boys Ricky & LJ, and over the past two days I completed it myself. Saved $875 thank you very much! Now it's time for smooth cruisin'.
#DIY #BestAssistantsEver

My 17-yr old son, Ricky, on vocals doing a cover of "Tuyo" recently made popular by the TV Show Narcos. Normally, Ricky plays cello in the Chamber Orchestra (has for past for past 8-9 yrs) and has rotated from the back row all the way up to 1st chair. 

THIS YEAR, he decided to do something completely outside his comfort zone and moved himself to the double-bass in the orchestra and has been playing bass with his friends in a cover band and singing more than ever. Last night he took it ONE STEP FURTHER and decided to take the stage with his best friend (guitar) and sing a song in Spanish at the High School Winter concert. BTW, this is his first appearance as a "lead singer" on any stage.

I was blown away. He never seizes to amaze me. What a courageous and talented young man. Proud poppa here :-D Hope you all enjoy.

Just pondering on a Tuesday...
I truly enjoy learning. As a singer, I enjoy watching other singers perform and learning from them. How they connect w/ their audience onstage/offstage, deal with technical difficulties, and of course, technique. One thing that has jumped out at me lately is the difference between performing for your audience and CONNECTING with your audience.
 
Myself included, sometimes singers are too nervous, inexperienced, or caught up in their onstage agenda (plan) to make that connection. When that happens, everybody loses and the performance becomes forgettable. The singer is missing out on connecting with their audience and the audience is missing out on a  meaningful performance that makes them feel some kind of way. Just thinking out loud and committing to be more conscious of this next time I'm onstage and grab the mic.
#TheArtOfPerformance
Mi mas reciente sencillo, "Nos Entendemos." Gracias por aceptar mi solicitud por FB. Un abrazo. -Ivan

Came across this interesting list (SEE LINK BELOW) today of best (and worst) countries to gig as a musician. The author based on FOUR things on a scale of 1-5, 5 being the best. 
* Artist Pay
* Hospitality
* Crowds
* Transit
Just curious, what's on your list of "best" and "worst" CITIES or COUNTRIES to play in? How about CITIES or COUNTRIES to avoid? Looks like I need to get to Germany ASAP, right Luis? 

For me, I would put JAPAN on my "best" that I've played at: Artist Pay-5, Hospitality-5, Crowds-5, Transit-3 (Crowded. Mass transit & parking are difficult).

data.post: Me siento entre familia con ustedes, so aquÃ­ les dejo un corto vÃ­deo de lo que estÃ¡ sucediendo con mi parÃ¡lisis facial (Bell's Palsy). Ya hoy es el dÃ­a #17, pero poco a poco mejorando. GRACIAS a todos ustedes por sus mensajes, llamadas, apoyo, oraciones, y buenas vibras. A la verdad que me siento bendecido tener personas en mi vida como ustedes. Al igual, saben que pueden contar conmigo. Â¡Los quiero! ððððµð·ð´ð¶ð¶ð¤ðð´ #QueVivaLaSalsa  #BellsPalsy
La nueva generaciÃ³n...Â¡hay esperanza!

To think, this was only 1 year ago when I traveled to Miami to record my first single "Yo La Enamore Con Salsa" and decided to start my own path as an independent recording artist. I had the song for over two years but had not had the courage to take the solo jump...honestly, I was so afraid to fail. But, SO MUCH HAS HAPPENED SINCE! ðð

That song would go on to be on DJ's playlists in Salsa clubs and radio stations all over the world. It would go all the way to #1 in Europe and be charted Top10 on commercial radio stations, Internet radio, clubs, record pools, festivals, and next month (September 2016) will be the First Dance song at a beautiful young couple's wedding. Wow! What an honor! One year ago, I dared to jump and the result has been incredible!  What I thought would be a lonely and scary journey turned out to be the opposite. 

I am now surrounded by others who dared to jump too...they are supportive and encourage me daily. Want to have your ego stroked? Surround yourself by a bunch of people that think just like you. Want the truth? Listen to different types of people and be open to getting your feelings hurt from time to time with 'the truth.' That's the path I chose. I have people like Pedro Jesus, Joe Campanella, William Otero, and my family who give it to me straight. It keeps me grounded. Yeah, I hear the negativity squawks too, but mostly from people stuck on the ledge afraid to take the leap. 

So now, a year later, I'm promoting my second single, "Nos Entendemos." This song has been received well by the industry as well AND has catapulted me into the Writer arena. All because I dared to jump and put myself out there in the first place. The reward is great. Do it...JUMP!!

data.post: Long day today. Maginda was admitted overnight for further evaluation and observation. She is in good spirits and under 1st class care. We feel confident this time we'll find a permanent resolution to an ever-persisting medical issue. THANK YOU to all of you who reached out in one way or another. Sorry I couldn't answer all the calls. She is in great hands and she thanks everyone for your kind words of encouragement and prayers. Ready for Day 2.

media.description:
Woke up w/ my face half-paralyzed last Friday. Went to see the Doc and long story short, I've been diagnosed with Bell's Palsy. 

From what I've learned, it's a TEMPORARY condition caused by any number of things and recovery time is anywhere between 2 weeks to 6 months, and very few suffer permanent damage. Mine was most likely brought on by an upper respiratory infection...I let a cold go untreated too long :-(  40,000 Americans diagnosed every year (.01% of U.S. pop). I've talked to some people who have had it or have known people that have had it and they seem to have recovered well; I hope the same for me. Since half of my face is temporarily paralyzed it's been a "fun" experience. Thought I would share with you the good and the bad.

1. THE BAD: Can't drink out of a straw (can't control half my lips so I just make a mess)
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Now I don't look like a sissy drinking out of a straw

2. THE BAD: Left eye doesn't close so I have to wear an eye-patch to protect my eye (cornea) from debris and wind irritation. I have to either tape down my eyelid or manually blink it to avoid tearing up
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: I get to wear an eye-patch and look like a real Pirate, Arrrgh!

3. THE BAD: Food tastes "funny" (taste buds are shot)
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Great time to expand my diet since my taste buds are on break

4. THE BAD: Can only chew on one side because only half of my mouth opens
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Saves me time when flossing...I can floss in half the time! As a bonus, I get to lose weight by eating less!

5. THE BAD: One ear sounds too low, while the other is too loud
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Now have a built-in monitor and it sounds better than most monitors I use on stage (musician joke, LOL)

6. THE BAD: Only half of my face smiles (lips, eyebrows, cheeks), only one eyebrow goes up
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Wrinkles on half of my face are less visible (relaxed skin), I can raise one eyebrow like The Rock, and if this condition sticks around through Halloween, I have the perfect Two-Face costume...all I have to do is draw a line right down the middle of my face!

Well, in all seriousness "message received" to take care of myself, cut down the stress, and focus on what's really important. I will have to cut down on my appearances temporarily, but will still be present ONLINE and hope to be back soon enough. Thank you to my wife, Mom, kids, and close family for looking after me and not taking any "blackmail pictures." LOL!! 

#BellsPalsy

data.post:
Woke up w/ my face half-paralyzed last Friday. Went to see the Doc and long story short, I've been diagnosed with Bell's Palsy. 

From what I've learned, it's a TEMPORARY condition caused by any number of things and recovery time is anywhere between 2 weeks to 6 months, and very few suffer permanent damage. Mine was most likely brought on by an upper respiratory infection...I let a cold go untreated too long :-(  40,000 Americans diagnosed every year (.01% of U.S. pop). I've talked to some people who have had it or have known people that have had it and they seem to have recovered well; I hope the same for me. Since half of my face is temporarily paralyzed it's been a "fun" experience. Thought I would share with you the good and the bad.

1. THE BAD: Can't drink out of a straw (can't control half my lips so I just make a mess)
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Now I don't look like a sissy drinking out of a straw

2. THE BAD: Left eye doesn't close so I have to wear an eye-patch to protect my eye (cornea) from debris and wind irritation. I have to either tape down my eyelid or manually blink it to avoid tearing up
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: I get to wear an eye-patch and look like a real Pirate, Arrrgh!

3. THE BAD: Food tastes "funny" (taste buds are shot)
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Great time to expand my diet since my taste buds are on break

4. THE BAD: Can only chew on one side because only half of my mouth opens
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Saves me time when flossing...I can floss in half the time! As a bonus, I get to lose weight by eating less!

5. THE BAD: One ear sounds too low, while the other is too loud
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Now have a built-in monitor and it sounds better than most monitors I use on stage (musician joke, LOL)

6. THE BAD: Only half of my face smiles (lips, eyebrows, cheeks), only one eyebrow goes up
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Wrinkles on half of my face are less visible (relaxed skin), I can raise one eyebrow like The Rock, and if this condition sticks around through Halloween, I have the perfect Two-Face costume...all I have to do is draw a line right down the middle of my face!

Well, in all seriousness "message received" to take care of myself, cut down the stress, and focus on what's really important. I will have to cut down on my appearances temporarily, but will still be present ONLINE and hope to be back soon enough. Thank you to my wife, Mom, kids, and close family for looking after me and not taking any "blackmail pictures." LOL!! 

#BellsPalsy
Happy Birthday my brother!

media.description:
On a personal note...
I don't strive to be better singer/musician than everyone else, I strive to be the best musician I can be. That's it! I completely get that my best may not be as good as other's best...I'm ok with that. It is what it is. I can honestly tell you that I truly enjoy surrounding myself w/ musicians/singers that are better than me. It's so exciting for me to be in their company when beautiful music is created. In the end I can only worry about what I can control, and that's ME. Thank you all for allowing me to share my musical experiences w/ you. I will continue as long as God allows me to, and as long as I continue to receive support. :-) #QueVivaLaSalsa

media.description:
As promised...**SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENT**
I think we can all agree that what happened in Orlando last week (mass shooting) was senseless. What's even more repulsive to me is that the club was targeted because it provided a "safe space" for the LGBT community in Orlando. Whether you agree with their lifestyle or not is IRRELEVANT, people are people, and they were massacred in cold blood. They all had families. For me it hits even closer to home because 23 of the 49 murder victims were from Puerto Rico...my PUERTO RICO. 

This topic of INTOLERANCE is exactly what my newest single "NOS ENTENDEMOS" is about. If two people LOVE each other, whether they are of the same sex, a beautiful woman w/ an "ugly" guy, or two people of different cultures (as it is in my case), as long as they 'understand each other' who are you to judge? As long as they love and respect each other, as long as they understand each other... Lives were lost and many others permanently destroyed. They need HELP putting some of the pieces back together and I found an excellent organization that is doing just that, "EQUALITY FLORIDA." I ask that you JOIN ME in supporting them.

As of TODAY, ALL PROFITS from my single "NOS ENTENDEMOS" will be donated to Equality Florida...100%. You can download my song for only .99 cents on iTunes, Amazon, Google Play, and CD Baby. Whatever profits I get from each sale, I will donate directly to @[13867925345:274:Equality Florida]. THANK YOU for your support ALWAYS and I pray these victims and family members can pick up the pieces and move ahead knowing that they are not alone. PLEASE SHARE.

Here are the links where you can purchase the song for .99 cents:
** CDBABY: http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/ivanmontero2

** iTUNES: https://itunes.apple.com/â¦/nos-entendemos-singâ¦/id1109572649

** AMAZON: https://amzn.com/B01F0CEVMK

** GOOGLE PLAY: https://play.google.com/store/music/album/Ivan_Montero_Nos_Entendemos?id=B355cjkdm47sjmu5mflflqfopzm&hl=en 

#OrlandoStrong

En casa esta noche viendo el documental "Una obra maestra antes de la medianoche (1961 - presente)" [A Masterpiece by Midnight] por PBS (2001). Se trata de la muerte prematura del jazz en la dÃ©cada de 1970 y su resurrecciÃ³n a partir de la dÃ©cada de 1980.

Me hizo pensar ... Muchas similitudes con nuestra mÃºsica Salsa amada incluyendo su Ã©poca de oro, ascenso y caÃ­da (y subir de nuevo), la historia, y la evoluciÃ³n. La clave para mantener la mÃºsica viva de la Salsa, como la mÃºsica de jazz, es "evolucionar " y "ampliar" la mÃºsica.

Nuestra "Salsa" de hoy no debe sonar como la de antaÃ±o. Debemos respetar y aprender del pasado, pero hay que seguir adelante. A mis colegas mÃºsicos, el reto es ser original y poner nuestro propio sello en este gÃ©nero Salsero que tanto amamos. Vamos a dejar de jugar a lo seguro y tomar riesgos creativos. Que viva la Salsa !

status_updates.title: Ivan Montero was watching Jazz (TV series).

data.post:
Watching documentary "A Masterpiece by Midnight (1961-Present)" on PBS (2001). It's about the premature death of jazz in the 1970s and its resurrection beginning in the 1980s. 

Got me thinking... Many similarities to our beloved Salsa music including its Golden era, rise and fall (and rise again), history, and evolution. The key to keeping Salsa music alive, like Jazz music, is to "evolve" and "expand" the music. 

Today's Salsa should NOT sound like yesteryear's "Salsa." We must learn from the past, respect it, but we must keep moving forward. To my fellow musicians, the challenge is to be original and put OUR stamp on this genre. Let's stop playing it safe and take creative risks. Que viva la Salsa!

media.description: Storm coming in! Yes, I got SOAKED!
Can't help but think someone was watching me today. Hmmmm
This was AFTER my run. 12 degree difference from when I started (in 1 hour).
Beginning of my run...HOT and HUMID!

data.post:
Hard 6-mile run today. Now paying for the short vacation last week. RAIN is back in the forecast on the daily and the heat is UP so I have to adjust my running time to the morning or early evening to avoid the heat and afternoon showers. No problem...life is full of adjustments, right? 
Today's run was a little creepy. Dark rain clouds with thunder and lightning approached on one end, and on the other end I couldn't help feel like someone was watching me. See pics below. See what I mean?
BTW, 12 degree difference in the hour I was out! I got caught in the storm...Soaked!

media.description: One year ago, I took a walk I had been waiting 27 years for, I graduated from college. It took a year of college right after high school, 22 years of Active Duty service in the Air Force, 2 years of community college, and finally 2 more years at University of South Florida. I would not trade for anything in the world the experience, emotion, and pride I felt that day as both my parents were present to watch me "walk." As if it couldn't get better, I was one of three people (of thousands graduating) the President of the college gave special recognition to in her speech to the graduating class. Then to top it off, my wife graduated with her Master's degree the very next day. #Priceless  #DareToDream #GoBulls

media.description: Taking a time-out from promotions to watch Anthony Bordain on CNN with the family. Tonight is a special broadcast (and Season premiere) where he visits the Philippines and highlights not only traveling spots throughout the Philippines, but the working Filipino woman's struggle as they leave home to work abroad to support their family back home. As you can imagine, this hits very close to home for us.

media.description:
CNN just confirmed that Prince Rogers Nelson has died. 

This is a tough one for me. He has been such an influence on me as a person and musician since my early teens. I talk about him ALL THE TIME...still! Was just talking about him yesterday and his fight w/ Warner Brothers...he was a PIONEER in changing the way so many record labels and distributors took advantage of the artists. "Slave" as he called it. He did everything HIS way and I admired him for that. 

He was heavily criticized once for cancelling a string of concerts during a spring season in the 80s, and his only response was, "Sometimes it snows in April." This April there will be showers of tears from all his fans. 

CNN is playing Prince music LIVE right now. We lost a music icon. #Inspirational

El 20 de abril de 2016 a las 12 del mediodÃ­a (tiempo Miami) / 9 a.m. (tiempo Los Angeles) voy a anunciar mi prÃ³xima producciÃ³n y fecha de lanzamiento. Este serÃ¡ mi segundo disco sencillo. ESTOY TAN ORGULLOSO de esta producciÃ³n ya que fui compositor de el tema junto al gran compositor Cubano Pedro Jesus. 

Â¿Alguna vez te has preguntado por quÃ© hay personas que se molestan al ver una pareja que se aman y son felices juntos? Luego no dejan de hablar de ellos?? Si, nos fuimos por ese camino... Â¡Ja! Â¡Ja!  Â¡Â¡SINTONICENSE!! :-D

I'M SO EXCITED!!!
On April 20, 2016 at 12NOON (Eastern)/9AM (Pacific) I will announce my next production and release date. This will be my second solo release. I AM SO PROUD of this production as I co-wrote the song with the great Cuban Singer/Songwriter Pedro Jesus. 

Ever wonder why people are so bothered by relationships that actually work? Then they can't stop talking about it??? Yup, we went there! TUNE IN!! :-D

media.description: Yo La Enamore Con Salsa made it to #1 on the charts!! THANK YOU!
Salsa music is alive and thriving in Europe! We made it to #1!! #YoLaEnamoreConSalsa
Top 20 list on Parada Mambo, Rome ITALY! We made it to #1!!!

data.post:
#1    #1     #1
WE MADE IT TO #1!!
LA RINGRAZIO MOLTO PER LA GENTE DI ITALIA!! 
After 7 weeks on the charts, YO LA ENAMORE CON SALSA moved up to #1 on âParada Mambo" on 106.9FM Radio Mambo radio station, Rome ITALY. 

THANK YOU to the Salseros in Europe for keeping Salsa music alive and a special THANK YOU to DJ Frank Guerra and all the Salseros in ITALY. I hope to meet you ALL soon! THANK YOU to my promotion team (my wife and I, LOL), fans, radio listeners, family, and EVERYONE who voted for my song. 

My debut single made it on several charts like Top 50, Top 200, Top 75, Top 10, Top 20, but this is my first #1. To God the Glory. I am humbled by this whole experience and canât wait to release my next single (coming soon!). Congratulations to Pedro Jesus (my writing partner and composer of Yo La Enamore Con Salsa) and all the musicians who played on this track. THANK YOU!!!

Better way to convert .wav to .mp3? 
The song I recorded last summer (my first single) was sent to me as a .wav file. I used Audacity to compress it to an mp3 so it can be easier to attach to an email when doing promotions (.wav file is too large to email, plus not sure if DJs will actually "download" if I send a WeTransfer or DropBox link), but it sounds compressed. Even in the club, when I hear it played, I can tell (maybe audience can't), that it does not sound crisp, clear, and loud. Any suggestions? Thx everyone!!

data.post: As a DJ, I am thrilled that FINALLY DJs will get a piece of the pie and get paid for their work (and skills). I can't tell you how frustrating it was for me when Soundcloud would take down my mixes or radio shows I would post because they couldn't figure out a way to pay the original artist, composer, etc. And as a Musician, I am elated that finally the musician, composer, etc WILL get paid when DJs include our work in their mixes. It's early, but as far as I can see, it's a WIN-WIN for people like me/us. #Dubset  #AppleMusic

So sad to share the news that my good friend and musical brother passed away last week in L.A.  Benny was a GREAT percussionist w/ tremendous instincts onstage (dynamics). Oh, and he was FUNNY!! We shared many stages together, but it was the best of times offstage, at rehearsal, in between sets, and just hanging out that I will cherish the most. He believed in everybody...even me...even when I didn't believe in my own abilities onstage, he'd put his arm around me, smile, and say let's got the bar and get a beer. 

For any of my L.A. Friends in the area that may want to attend a memorial for him please see my friend Bobby's post below. The memorial is actually a RUMBA, Benny would have it no other way. 

Damn Benny...rest in peace my brother. You will be missed.

media.description:
STILL trending high in "Popularity" on iTunes. 
It is unbelievable how far of a reach we can get with digital promotions these days. In the last couple of weeks through iTunes alone, the single has moved across Europe, U.S., and Latin America, including Argentina, Bolivia, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Estonia, Guatemala, Honduras, Latvia, Lithuania, Netherlands, Nicaragua, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, and Venezuela. 

The FULL ALBUM is officially in the works...NEW music coming soon! THANK YOU for being there for Independent Artists. 

In addition to traditional Radio stations (a.k.a. "Terrestial Radio"), iTunes, Amazon, CD Baby, Google Play, Pandora, Spotify, iHeart Radio, ALL Independent Internet Radio....these ARE our distribution channels. Please support them, as they provide us with a platform for our music. 
#MindBlown #iTunes #DigitalAge

data.post: In a copy-cat industry like MUSIC, it is extremely difficult to stand out. Beg, borrow, or steal what you want from whomever you want, if you want, but at the end of the day, YOU make the difference. What makes you, YOU? If you have nothing to contribute to your music, your music will sound like everybody else's music... because it is. Be original.
Happy Birthday amigo!!

Just learned the sad news of the passing earlier today of a good friend in Corpus Christi, CHRIS ORTIZ. This Boricua was a legend in radio and was quite the promoter for Salsa and tropical music. He would also come to the events we performed at in Corpus and always had nothing but encouraging words to say. I'll pass on funeral details as I get them. My deepest condolences to his brother, George, and the rest of the family. We lost a great one today.

comments.comment: Como pasa el tiempo y como cambian las cosas. Ãstas grabaciones que estÃ¡n en tus pÃ¡ginas las llevo muy dentro de mi corazÃ³n. Fueron grabadas hace 13 aÃ±os en Los Ãngeles como un "demo" para nuestra orquesta, L.A. Salsa Connection, y en solo horas, con la orquesta completa en el mismo estudio a la misma vez, grabamos estas 3 canciones en "2" tape." Hoy dÃ­a hacemos las grabaciones un poco diferente. TODO es digital (no cinta) y grabamos separados en diferentes estudios, algunos hasta en sus casas solos. :-) Ni modo, brego con lo nuevo y trato de ajustarme a la nueva tecnologia. Gracias Joe, mi Padrino Musical, por siempre apoyarme y guiarme por estos lares cocolos, pero mas importante para mi por siempre ser mi amigo. Te quiero un montÃ³n y te doy las gracias por compartir estas gratas memorias. Un abrazo. #QueVivaLaSalsa BTW, a lo mejor es tiempo de re-grabarlas hmmmmmm??? ;-)

media.description: Thinking out loud...one of those days. I NEVER lived in a house more than 3 years until halfway through my Air Force career when I was stationed in Los Angeles, California, and lived in a house for 5. Throughout my 22-year career in the Air Force, the most I was stationed at a job was 4 1/2 years; basically, every 1 1/2 to 4 1/2 years, I moved to either a different job or a different location (city/state/country). Today, I've been in Tampa Florida 4 1/2 years since my retirement from the AF and I have to admit...a clock is going off in my mind as if it's time... I lived in L.A. nearly half of my Air Force career, my two youngest were born there and started school there, and lately, L.A. has been heavy on my mind. Moving back to L.A. makes no sense at this point due to my wife's career here in Tampa and the connections I'm making in the music industry here that I simply could not make in L.A., but just wanted to let my friends and musician family back in L.A. know that although I moved away, my heart is still in L.A. Maybe all I need is just a short visit to get it out of my system. We'll see. Thanks for allowing me to vent and if you've read this far...thanks for caring. :-)

comments.author: Ray Cruz

comments.comment: Not my current single, but the first single I EVER recorded in a studio. The first DJ to play my first recording was YOU. I don't know if you remember, but almost 20 years ago (1998), my wife and I spent a week in Hawaii (Honeymoon/Change of Station stop) when we were moving from Okinawa Japan to L.A. While in Hawaii, I visited you at a club that was in a hotel ( I think the name started with an "A"??). It was a "humbling experience" kind of recording (yeah, it needed a LOT of work LOL), but you were so gracious to play it and I will forever be grateful for that. I felt like a star that night!!  I'm pretty sure it was on CD, but it might have even been on cassette!! I had a bunch of copies on tape I was carrying around for 'promotion.' LOL!!! Great times!!
comments.author: Ivan Montero

comments.comment: Wow! I had really forgotten about that BUT for sure not about out friendship. When I first met you in L.A. you were so gracious and we were the first DJ's to have a DJ symposium about what DJ's was supposed to be. We were ahead of our time. As far as I am concerned there are a few "keepers of the flame" and we are in that group. Thank You for being a true friend through the years. I think the place was either Rumors, Renies or the Palms on base at Hickam AFB  PS you are a star...we do what we do as labor of love and we are lucky that our better halves allow us that freedom. Take care Pana. Ivan Montero
comments.author: Ray Cruz

comments.comment: Gracias Ray, you know the feeling is mutual. You are more than just a DJ, you are a Salsa Music Curator. I can only imagine the collection you must have.  Maybe the club was Rumors. I remember it was in a hotel and it was pretty grand looking. That's actually where we first met. We would meet again in L.A. a couple years later at the Salsa Congress. Crazy world...glad you're in mine!

data.post:
Today, I received the GREAT news that my song, "Yo La Enamore Con Salsa" was picked up and is immediately available through the Pandora (music app). This is a HUGE step as an independent artist. 

The process to be approved into Pandora as an independent is extremely tedious and slow, but the exposure is priceless. They own a technology called the "Music Genome Project" which groups similar music together based on hundreds/thousands of "genes" of a song. They scientifically group similar music with the idea that if you like the song you looked up, you will most likely like the music they matched up to it. 

I've been listening to the station and I have to say I am so honored and amazed at not only their description of my music, but at who they matched me up with! OMG! That they put me in the same category as some of these legendary Salsa artists...wow. I am humbled. 

I invite you to go to Pandora and create your own "Ivan Montero" and check out the Salsa music they grouped me with. I may be a little biased, but IT IS SOOO GOOD!! I love it! Pandora took their time, but they created a fantastic channel for my music full of great music/artists. Enjoy!
#Pandora
#MusicGenomeProject
#ProudMoment
#Validation
#IvanMonteroRadio
I received GREAT news today regarding my single, "Yo La Enamore Con Salsa." Will share later today...wow!!

media.description:
WHAT A YEAR 2015 was for me and my family! So much has been going on I haven't had the time to reflect. All I can say right now is that I am GRATEFUL to all of YOU for allowing me to make my dream come true and finally cross over into officially being a Producer/Recording Artist. The screen shot below shows sales of my single during the last couple of weeks in December. iTunes, Amazon, Apple Music, YouTube, Rhapsody, Spotify...my song sold everywhere and reached people all over the world. To say that I feel encouraged is an understatement...I feel like freakin' KING KONG! 2016...oh it's on!! 
#YoLaEnamoreConSalsa
#WorldWide

media.description:
I am a Christian. 
I realize many of my friends/family do not share my religious beliefs and I'm ok with that. I also understand there are people that punch holes in biblical passages by utilizing scientific evidence and/or archaeology...that's ok with me too. I question many things as well. But the dispute of whether or not Jesus was actually born on the 25th of December in Bethlehem is not as important to me as much as celebrating that as a Christian, I BELIEVE he WAS BORN and he IS our Savior. If he was actually born in the summer, spring, or on another planet it really doesn't matter to me. The general consensus among Christians is that he was born on the 25th of December in Bethlehem and I accept that. I celebrate the birth of Jesus Christ, period. I hope you all have a great "Holiday Season," "Winter Break," or whatever you may choose to call this time of the year, but with all due respect yo you all, to me, it's Merry Christmas. Peace and Love. -IM

It was an opportunity to grow, learn, and meet some wonderful musicians whom I now call friends.  I have decided to pursue the next chapter of my musical career and take the next step to create my own band, sound, and identity.  I have been a part of many bands and am excited to put everything Iâve learned into my own band. THANK YOU all for your never-ending support and I hope to see you again very soonâ¦with my own band! ;-)

media.description: On a day like today, I can't help but think of my MILITARY brothers and sisters stationed away from home...PROTECTING OUR HOME. In particular, thinking about my brother Luis Montero, who is on Active Duty in the Air Force (past 18 years) and is currently deployed to Qatar while his wife and 3 kids are back in Germany and the rest of his family in the U.S. and Puerto Rico. He won't be home until early 2016. He's done this before and he's doing it again, that's what he does. I don't share this so you can feel sorry for him, he's ok, I share it to help people understand that in order for us to live the way we live here in the U.S, people like Luis have to live like he does abroad. I remember being stationed overseas by myself and without family...but I WAS NEVER ALONE. Military families are STRONG and we take care of each other. BE THANKFUL, especially on a day like today, for people like my brother who are willing to sacrifice their lives in order for you to live yours. Please be grateful to ALL VETERANS. I love you, Luis...stay strong, we got your six! #AimHigh

media.description:
LARRY HARLOW??? WHAT??!! 
And the blessings continue. The thought of having my voice reach the ears of a living Salsa legend like Larry Harlow just blows my mind! Today, he gifted me with encouraging words and at the same time, gave me the most honest feedback I've received so far (other than the feedback I get from my Musical Mentor Joe Campanella, of course...brutal!! LOL). What an honor! And on Veteran's Day too?! I will take all this feedback I'm receiving from everyone and pour it into my next recording. Coming soon! #Blessed

media.description: Maginda and I at Recruiting Annual Banquet.
One of my first trips home after joining the Air Force. I was 21 yrs old in this pic
Here w/ a JASDEF (Japanese Self Defense Forces) Chinook in Okinawa, Japan.
You can't see me, but I can certainly see you! That's me in the back of an F-15D flying over Okinawa, Japan
Maginda and I's first Air Force Banquet in Okinawa Japan. Many moons ago. LOL!
My promotion to Staff Sergeant (SSgt) in Los Angeles CA
Receiving my Air Force Commendation Medal from my Commander, Lt Col Haynes for my service in Okinawa, Japan (Feb 1994 - July 1998)
Doing a little Administrative work never hurt anyone (well, except for those darn paper cuts!)
Ready to go up in an F-15D...1:15 minutes of PURE ADRENALINE in the skies over Okinawa Japan
My brief time with Security Forces at Keesler Air Force Base, Mississippi.
Here with the JASDEF Chinook Aircrew. It was a fantastic flight (if you like flying in yo-yos). Been there, done that too.
Paperwork never ends!
Alright, let's get to work!

data.post: Happy Veteran's Day to my fellow Brothers and Sisters in Arms. I stood with you, by you, and for you...and you for me. I can't say that in my 22 years in the Air Force (Sep 1989 - Oct 2011) I did it all, but I sure tried. ;-) I am so PROUD of my AIR FORCE and our country, but especially proud of those that came before us like my uncle Tio Arsenio Montero (Army-Korean War), my father Jimmy Montero (Army-Vietnam Veteran), my brother Luis Montero (Air Force-still on Active Duty, stationed in Qatar), and to those that despite what they read in the papers or see on the news are still willing to put their money where their mouth is and sign on the dotted line for your country. That takes cojones and I salute you! Celebrate...and that's an order!! Here are a handful of pics throughout my career. #AimHigh

media.description:
ATTN DJs & REMIXERS:
This is exciting!! I received numerous remixes of my Salsa single, YO LA ENAMORE CON SALSA...some are INTRO remixes only, others are FULL REMIXES. Soâ¦.I thought it would be fun to include a couple of remixes on the physical Single CD when I put it out. (And YES, people STILL want physical CDs...who knew?!) AS OF TODAY, I am opening up a REMIX COMPETITION to ALL Djs and Remixers to submit their remix of my song, YO LA ENAMORE CON SALSA. The TOP REMIXES will be uploaded to my website and the FANS will decide (by vote) which two remixes will be included on the single CD when released. All entries must be received by midnight, Nov 20, 2015. WINNERS will be announced Dec 1, 2015. Inbox me with your email address to receive the Instrumental/Acapella versions. Best of luck to you all and I canât wait to hear your REMIX!
#YoLaEnamoreConSalsa

Watching the Glen Campbell documentary on CNN, "I'll be me." The documentary is about Glen's farewell tour after being diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease. I pray for Glen Campbell's family and for all families like salsero Victor Manuelle's family dealing with Alzheimer's disease. 
#GlenCampbell
#AlgoLePasaAMiHeroe

media.description:
ATTN DJs & REMIXERS:
This is exciting!! I received numerous remixes of my Salsa single, YO LA ENAMORE CON SALSA...some are INTRO remixes only, others are FULL REMIXES. Soâ¦.I thought it would be fun to include a couple of remixes on the physical Single CD when I put it out. (And YES, people STILL want physical CDs...who knew?!) AS OF TODAY, I am opening up a REMIX COMPETITION to ALL Djs and Remixers to submit their remix of my song, YO LA ENAMORE CON SALSA. The TOP REMIXES will be uploaded to my website and the FANS will decide (by vote) which two remixes will be included on the single CD when released. All entries must be received by midnight, Nov 20, 2015. WINNERS will be announced Dec 1, 2015. Inbox me with your email address to receive the Instrumental/Acapella versions. Best of luck to you all and I canât wait to hear your REMIX! 
#YoLaEnamoreConSalsa

media.description:
Well, my dream was to record an original Salsa song in a professional studio with professional musicians. The response has been overwhelming, exciting, and humbling at the same time. Here I sit today, sorting through new music. Hmmmm...decisions, decisions. What does the public want? Salsa Clasica, Romantica, funny, covers, tributes...??? You tell me. What would you like to hear me do next? Topics? This is so exciting! THANK YOU for your support! :-D
#NextStep

Para los que no saben, ademas se ser artista y cantante, el hombre ha compuesto cientos de canciones, entre ellas Ã©xitos como âTe Propongoâ para Victor Manuelle, âEl Gallo No Olvidaâ para Tito Rojas, y un sinnÃºmero mÃ¡s para otros artistas independientes y tambien reconocidos como Tito GÃ³mez (QEPD), Luisito CarriÃ³n, Maelo RuÃ­z, Puerto Rican Power, Lefty PÃ©rezâ¦..y sigue la lista. âYo La EnamorÃ© Con Salsaâ fue escrita por Ã©l despuÃ©s de una conversaciÃ³n por telÃ©fono que tuvimos donde platicamos el tema en general basado en como mi esposa y yo nos conocimosâ¦tras la Salsa. 
Mi primer tema iba a ser algo fuerte, callejero, como la Salsa de los 70s como tanto me gusta, pero Pedro me dirigiÃ³ hacia otra direcciÃ³n en la cual me permite hablar de algo que muchos nos podemos identificar como el amor, y a la vez me diÃ³ el espacio para arreglar el tema fuerte y con swing. data.post:
Played in Qatar!!
My brother, Luis Montero, is on Active Duty (Air Force) and currently stationed in Qatar. He is also a DJ and played my song for the troops during their Latin Night at the club! Like Moncho Rivera says, "Que clase viaje!" ...What a trip!
#YoLaEnamoreConSalsa

This is my good friend and former classmate and choir member, Velmont (a.k.a. Vel, or V). He is XX years old (you wouldn't believe me if I told you) and still sings in the Hillsborough Community College (HCC) Choir and dances like nobody is looking...ALWAYS! He is a great spirit and an inspiration to be around. Here's Vel dancing to my new Salsa single, "Yo La Enamore Con Salsa" at the HCC 'Welcome Back Students' party. Thank you Carlos for playing my song!! #AgeAintNothingButANumber #HCCYbor

"YO LA ENAMORE CON SALSA" llegÃ³ a Connecticut y NYC por medio de "El Show de Henry Ayala." No es por nada, pero el show estÃ¡ sabroso...SALSA para el bailador!! Escuchen de lunes a viernes 11AM-12PM y se repite de 5-6PM.
#YoLaEnamoreConSalsa

I cannot express how GRATEFUL I am to all those that have supported me on this EPIC journey through this crazy world of MUSIC. My new single is in rotation at radio stations (AM/FM) as well as internet radio stations throughout the U.S. and the world! Incredible. My FIRST SALE online was within the first hour, the first day, and was to someone in SOUTH KOREA!! Go figure! In this short time, people have purchased my song from Italy to the Canary Islands to many places in between...WOW!!!
As a bonus, the song has a high "Popularity" rating in iTunes, which is based on sales in iTunes. Wow! Wow! Wow! THANK YOU from the bottom of my heart...Week 1 isn't even over yet!! I feel so blessed to be able to finally share this music I've had bottled up in my head for so long with all of you. Thank you for joining me on this wonderful journey. I can't wait to share the rest!!
#YoLaEnamoreConSalsa

data.post: EXACTLY. Let's put our egos in our back pockets and support one another. "Support" to me means to be patient with others, to teach, to guide, to show up, to network, NOT talk smack or highlight others flaws without offering some suggestion to help them grow, to become and maintain a community, to advocate for and with, to CORRECT WHEN NECESSARY, to not forget about those still figuring things out, to set a standard, to help out financially (when possible), and finally to remember that without each other we have NO community. Many Blessings and good vibes to ALL. :-D
What's good, Jimmie?!! Thanks for the add.

media.description: Just want to take a minute to thank my Musical Mentor, Joe Campanella. For those of you who may not be familiar with him, he is a trumpet player and one of the founding members of @[230279038264:274:La Corporacion Latina] in Puerto Rico. 'Back in the day' Joe and I had a band together in Los Angeles, "L.A. Salsa Connection." We both learned so much about the current state of Salsa music, arranging, promoting, etc, but most of all Joe took me under his wing and TAUGHT ME the history of Salsa music as he lived it from his neighborhood of Puerta de Tierra in PR to a top-billing act in Puerto Rico, New York, and Latin America during the late 1960s into the mid 1970s...the 'Glory Days' of Salsa. To this day, we stay in touch and I consult with him greatly on EVERYTHING music. Thank you @[100000601448582:2048:Joe] for your unending support in everything I do and especially for your extreme patience with me over the years as I learned that music is more than oneself, music belongs to the people and ought to be respected as such. Thanks you for keeping me straight and above all, GROUNDED/HUMBLE. Love ya!

media.description:
Hello Facebook World!! As some of you may have already heard, YES IT'S TRUE, the mastering process of my single is finally complete. I still have to take care of some administrative stuff (registration, copyright, distribution arrangements, etc.) before I release it to make sure I protect my "product." I PROMISE, I will get it out there as soon as I get through all this red tape. I CAN'T WAIT to officially release it! I'm already working towards the next project (Hint: collaboration w/ major studio in Miami and new artist from Cuba). I AM SO EXCITED!!! Thank you for your support and your patience while I go through the tail end of this process. Que viva la Salsa!! :-D
#GodIsGreat
#DreamsComeTrue #MonteroMusic  #WalkQuietlyAndCarryABigSword

media.description: That's a wrap! Mix complete, now off to mastering. #CoffeeTime

data.post: Last time I recorded music in a studio, the band was all together in the same studio on the same day. We recorded 3 songs on 2-inch tape and by the end of the day we had our demo, mixed, and mastered (sort of...lol). To say the process has changed would be a HUGE understatement. Today, everything is digital. Nothing tangible: no tape, no record, no CD...even the mixdown can be done with software on the computer, then shared and stored in cyberspace. This technology allows for part of a song to be recorded in Puerto Rico, another in Miami, others in Orlando, Kissimmee, and Deltona Florida!! Well, such is the case with the song I'm working on now. Today, I will sit down with a Grammy-award winning sound engineer in Miami FL to mix all these tracks together and finally form a complete song. This is a true collaboration. I've been working on this project on and off for a couple of years so to think that I will finally get to hear what we've been creating for the first time makes me super excited!! I pray it all sounds the way I've been hearing it in my head for so long and I also hope you all enjoy the final product. :-)  Well, here we go! #MagicIsInTheMix

data.post: 7 classes and 4 weeks later, I am grateful for the opportunity to have taught 1st-7th graders at my Jr DJ Academy at Hillsborough Community College's (HCC) Summer Camp. I learned so much from my students!! HCC tells me this was one of the most popular courses (if not, THE most popular course) this summer. Tampa Bay's Channel 9 (Bay News 9) came by during one of our sessions last Friday and interviewed a few of my students for a piece which airs today (I think my part is on editing room floor LOL). I don't have my hands on a video yet, but in the meantime, here's the news story:  #JrDJAcademy #MonteroMusic #HCC
AquÃ­ con mi pana "El FrancÃ©s" Frank Poupart, haciÃ©ndole coro a mi compueblano, Omar Negron en un guiso auspiciado por otro gran amigo, Jorge Laureano #Familia  #MasSalsaQuePescao
Ja! Ja! Un poquito de humor para que pasen un buen fin de semana :-D

From what has been reported so far, the COWARD shot at the Marines from his car, outside the Armed Forces Recruiting office. If he really wanted to die, why didn't he just walk into the office and try to take on the Marines like a man? Supposedly, he was trained in MMA-style fighting. Why not?? Because he was a piece of shit COWARD!! Ironic that the "Armed Forces" office appeared to be unarmed. Recruiting offices (like the ones my brother, Luis, and I used to recruit from for the Air Force) are out in the community and are vulnerable. Sad day for America, the Armed Forces of America, Military Recruiters, and especially for all my brothers and sisters in arms (current and former) in the Marine Corps. #SemperFi

data.post: This is my "office" for this week...Ybor City, FL. This is week 4 (of 4) of my Jr DJ Academy and wraps up a 4-week/4-campus tour of the Jr DJ Academy. If anyone would have told me I would be teaching kids, grades 1st-8th, I would have told them they were nuts! Look at me now. Ha Ha. To share your knowledge is the greatest gift...I feel blessed for this opportunity. #JrDJAcademy

Exhausted...but happy. Balancing work, family, school, and music is A LOT of work, but it is ALL very rewarding. Long days and very long nights indeed. In the next few weeks I finish teaching my DJ Academy classes AND a summer class at Univ of South Florida...THEN, I can completely focus on the release of my first single. data.post: 18 years ago on a beautiful, hot, and sunny day on the island of Okinawa Japan, I married the love of my life. We have been tested and tried over the years, as all couples are, but we remain strong and here we are today...inseparable still. In the last 18 years we completed our college together (she's my college sweetheart, too), made a new home every time the Air Force moved us, made some bills, paid off some bills, made some bills...been each other's rock in times of devastation, and been each other's cheerleader in times of triumph, but a true testament to our love have been the two children that God blessed us with. When I look at them, I think of LOVE...and when I think of LOVE, all I think about is YOU, Maginda. I LOVE YOU...Happy Anniversary!

media.description: JOHNNY POLANCO. A legend in the music industry by any standard. What DIDN'T he do? Arranger, composer, trombone, cuatro, trÃ©s cubano, lyricist, producer, gÃ¼iro, maracas, guitar (acoustic & electric), vibraphone (heavy as hell too!), producer, appeared in movies and TV shows..... I performed as a DJ next to him on countless occasions and even auditioned for his band when @[1159331452:2048:Angelo] and Jorge left (I didn't make the cut, obviously, but even when he said 'no' he gave me great advice on how to improve and ALWAYS treated me with respect and dignity). Our 'spot' was the CONGA ROOM and on occasion the SPORTSMAN'S LODGE, but we gigged all over the place together at festivals and private events alike. He was as honest and straightforward as they come and would tell you he liked something just as easily as he would give you a "limaso" (well deserved I might add too). To see him onstage was a treat but to be around him backstage, before the show, after the show, packing equipment in that old tank of a car he had in dark alley ways, musty, smelly, dark, creepy, alley ways...THAT was gold! I learned so much about PROFESSIONALISM and RESPECT for your audience from Johnny. If you knew Johnny, you know exactly what I'm talking about, but if you didn't...you really did. You know that one person that always tells you like it is even when you're feelings get hurt, but you know they are right?...the person you think about and wonder, 'What would so-and-so say about this'...that person was Johnny. Proud to have crossed paths with him. Rest in peace my Brother-in Arms. Semper Fi.
