data.post:
MEMORIAL DAY is to remember those who DIED WHILE SERVING in the United States' Armed Forces. It doesn't necessarily mean you have to hold funeral-like activities all weekend. How YOU remember is totally up to YOU. All I ask is that somewhere, sometime during this weekend you take a moment to reflect the true reason for this holiday we observe...remember those Killed in Action (KIA) and Missing in Action (MIA) that never came home.
     For the record, it is not "Happy Memorial Day" as we are remembering the fallen. My father, brother, cousins, myself, and other family members were fortunate enough to have made it back home to our families, however, that has not always been the case in our family. Attached are some pictures from a book published in Puerto Rico about fallen Heroes from my hometown of Utuado where a relative (my paternal Grandmother's uncle) Jose Montero, is recognized. He was Killed-In-Action in the Korean War in 1951.
     JOSE MONTERO was a volunteer to fight in both wars, World War II and Korean War. He was from UTUADO. As a member of the 65th Infantry Regiment of Puerto Rico, this highly decorated soldier participated in military action in Panama, North Africa, France, Germany, and finally, Korea, where he was Killed In Action in 1951. He was only one month away from returning home when he was killed while out on patrol. He was married and had two children (two girls). He was also a musician :-) and played the Cuatro and guitar. He served a total of 14 years in the U.S. Army.

data.post: It's ironic that the keynote speaker at the Ring Ceremony tonight mentioned he is big on symbolism; so am I. In fact, as a symbol of conquering the next level, while honoring the past, I wore my High School graduation ring to the ceremony tonight, and officially replaced it with my new College ring. I've been waiting a lifetime to do that. I also wore my 'United States Air Force Retired' lapel pin centered on my tie to represent a "lifetime" of military service between the rings. #TechCentaurs #AimHigh #GoBulls

Everything and everybody is in place. Ready for our Ring Ceremony to begin. Maginda and I will both be receiving our rings tonight. Maginda for her Master's in Adult Education and mine for my Bachelors in International Studies. Exciting! #validation #USF #GoBulls

data.post: #tbt Going back 20 years today! Although I played in bands before this, the first band I sang lead was LATIN CONNECTION while I was stationed in Okinawa, Japan in the mid 90's. The original band was formed by Alberto "Colo" Rivera, Steve "Vampiro" Blas, & myself, and included band members Victor Mercado, David "Nico" Santiago, "Doc" Grayling, Henry Feliciano, Daniel "El Cubano", and Carlos Duchense. We used to rehearse in my living room in Base Housing. WHAT A BLAST!!! Just a band of military brothers (in this case Marines, Navy, Air Force & civilians) coming together to bring joy to military personnel and their families while stationed in a foreign country. MUSIC is a beautiful thing!
Follow me on Twitter: @IvanOnTheRadio
Join us!
Felicidades amigo!!!

My secret is out. While some DJs continue to crank out $300+ for inferior Dre Beats headphones, I'll give it to them for putting together an EXCELLENT marketing campaign for "high-end" headphones, but just not my preference. I continue to scoop up REAL professional (Shure) headphones for $79-$99. #1 headphones on this list and on mine as well for quite some time. 
   BTW, I'd like to give an honorable mention to Sennheiser. Bought a $25 pair at Guitar Center on sale a while back for my keyboard, and they sound almost as good as my Shure headphones...almost. :-) #SuckerForNameBrand #SuckerFree

* Best Tropical Latin Album - Carlos Vives (Sony Music Latin)
* Best Latin Pop Album - Ruben Blades (Sunnyside Records)

comments.comment: @Benny. I was thinking the same thing but I'm seeing ads for multiple Valentines Day dances. With several bands using the same pool of musicians, I don't know how they're going to pull it off unless they go w/ MIDI bands. I was going to work w/ someone for a dance that day, but I'm thinking about pulling out. :-/
comments.author: Ivan Montero

comments.comment: @Marii - In the 3 years that I've been in this area, it seems bands have a hard time holding on to their members. I've lost count of the bands I've played with here that are DONE after a couple of gigs because they were underbid by another band, which also fell apart because another band undercut them...it doesn't stop. I can't make this stuff up. I've been in towns where bandmembers play in multiple bands (Los Angeles), but they didn't undercut each other to the point of extinction like they do around these parts. There's so much talent here, I wish they could get it together. #DividedWeFall
comments.author: Ivan Montero

media.description: With Valentine's Day falling on a Saturday this year, it seems like there are going to be many options for Live Salsa music in the Central/Southern Florida area (just to clarify, by "Live" I mean full orchestra). On one side of the coin it will be nice to have so many options, but on the other side, it can feel like bands could be undercutting each other in an area where they need to work together more. What do I know? Your thoughts??

comments.comment: Latin market is too saturated with junk. Cookie cutter productions ran its course a while ago. The music all sounds the same. Arrangements are similar to others and lack creativity. It got old quick! People are seeking the classics, the songs they remember by not only lyrics, but by the music itself. Bands have gone the wayside. Where is the creative canvas? Where is the natural talent? Independent latin bands need to come back, establish a sound and frontman to go with it. Read the credits on recent works and you will find the same people playing, the same arrangers, the same meh. Music creativity was lost and needs to be placed up front, not the pretty face. Natural talent! No autotunes, sequencing or sampling! I could go on..
comments.author: Charlie Ortiz

comments.comment: The music industry is done.. and it will be worse... Great topic Ivan Montero
comments.author: Adrian Treto II

comments.comment: It's sad but true, no creativity. I remember a couple of years ago when Ruben Blades made an album with Spanish Harlem Orchestra and the song 'Un gran dia en el Barrio' came out. It was a new song that sounded like a classic 70's song.

media.description: As of mid October NO ALBUMS were certified PLATINUM (one million copies sold) by the RIAA. Since then, only a couple of ALBUMS have been certified PLATINUM, Taylor Swift "1989," and Sam Smith "In The Lonely Hour." That's the status of the music industry in the U.S...The LATIN MUSIC industry is much worse. The number of copies required for Gold and Platinum certification by the RIAA has been adjusted over the years, but by any standard, sales are down. TIMES HAVE CHANGED. The traditional music model HAS changed - artists have to adjust to survive or sink. Full Albums are great projects, especially for the artist, but with sales plummeting year-after-year, it is quickly becoming a market of singles. The numbers don't lie. YOUR THOUGHTS?

data.post: WARNING**These Florida politicians better pay attention to the I-4 corridor. They can call us what they want behind closed doors, but the reality is they can no longer ignore us. The PUERTO RICAN population has grown to nearly a million in Florida, quickly creeping up to the Cuban population in FL at 1.3 million). This bulk of this group of Puerto Ricans are no longer the typical factory worker that came from the island to Brooklyn & the Bronx in the 50s & 60s. This group is highly educated (many in PR) and are "doctors, nurses, teachers, engineers, lawyers, managers and professors." Florida is the beneficiary of the 'Brain Drain' occurring in PR today. But none of that gives our communities power UNLESS WE VOTE. Get out and vote tomorrow BORICUA POWER! ***VOTE***

In recent interviews, WILLIE COLON mentioned that MARC ANTHONY (in the movie "El Cantante" where he portrayed Hector Lavoe) was basically a 'KARAOKE SINGER.' Based on what I saw in the interview, I'm assuming he means that Marc sang/recorded the songs not much different than the way they were originally recorded, therefore making it more of a 'karaoke' performance instead of making them his own. Willie didn't say they weren't good, in fact, he said Marc has a 'nice voice.' What he said was that Marc did a 'karaoke of Hector Lavoe.' From what I can tell, Willie was specifically talking about Marc's performance in the movie, El Cantante, NOT in general. If you interpreted it a different way, I'd like to hear from you. Gracias!

Most of us have seen it by now...the "slap" heard around Latin America! Personally, I don't think Willie should have touched him like that, but I do understand that he felt the reporter crossed the line by asking about about his troubled son. It's a relatively old issue, and given the nightclub setting, I feel like it was an inappropriate time to get into such a serious issue. I feel as if the reporter was trying to get a sensational reaction to a sensational question...I suppose he got what he was asking for. Your opinion?

SPANISH, 'SPANGLISH', or ENGLISH?
**Need your help**
As you know, I broadcast a radio show on USF's Bulls Radio where I play Latin music: Salsa, Merengue, Cumbia, Bachata, Vallenato, Reggaeton... Right now, the show is broadcast in 'Spanglish.' For the simple fact that the station is located on USFâs campus, my primary audience is the students, secondly, all listeners online, wherever they may be listening from in the world. 
QUESTIONS FOR YOU?
(1) DO YOU THINK THE SHOW SHOULD BE 100% SPANISH? 100%ENGLISH? or a mix ("SPANGLISH")?
(2) WHY? 
Without offending anyone ;-) explain why
I look forward to hearing your responses.
-IM

media.description: PapÃ¡ relaxing in 'la marquesina' after a long day at work.
Makeshift coffee bean sorting and cleaning machine.
This is what a Puerto Rican coffee grower looks like. A true JÃ­baro. This is PapÃ¡.
Me (@19 yrs old) getting the 'barro' (clay soil) out of my shoes w/ my pocketknife. Barro stains are a badge of honor where we come from...just like the 'mancha de plÃ¡tano' (plantain stains).
Puerto Rican gold...our coffee. (pic taken from the roof of the house, where he used to dry the coffee out under the sun).

data.post:
HAPPY INTERNATIONAL COFFEE DAY!
The day is used internationally to promote Fair Trade coffee and to raise awareness for the plight of coffee growers. As you may or may not know my family's story, particularly on my father's side, begins with COFFEE. My Grandfather (we all call him PapÃ¡) and his family were HUGE coffee growers in the mountains of Utuado, Puerto Rico, where some of the best Arabica coffee beans in the world were/are cultivated. (Some say during that time it was exclusively served at the Vatican for the Pope). Long story short, oversupply of coffee in the late 1950s caused the price of coffee worldwide to drop immensely, which led many coffee farmers to either switch to another crop or explore alternatives such as leaving PR to check out opportunities in the U.S. PapÃ¡ chose to temporarily leave his wife and 5 children behind in PR, while exploring those options here in the U.S. He would secure employment, then return to PR to get his family to start a new life in America...and the rest, as they say, is history. He would return to PR for a short time in the 80s to try his hand once again (after retiring from his job in the U.S.), but ended up back in the U.S. where he lives today. He is 92 and still keeps himself busy in his garden when weather permits. Below are some pictures of a visit I paid him at his coffee plantation in the 80s where he took me out to pick coffee with him. Even though he was the owner of the field and the boss, he outworked EVERYONE! Quick fact: Coffee is NOT grown in the U.S. (except Hawaii). ALL coffee consumed in the U.S. is IMPORTED...think about that. Here's to a Happy International Coffee Day and while you enjoy that great cup of coffee today, I hope you think of PapÃ¡ and coffee growers all over the world with a smile on your face. :-D

Guitar Center in financial trouble, but it's not what you may think. The company is $1.6 BILLION in debt, but that's mostly debt from when the company was acquired back in 2007 by Bain Capitol. So, I don't know which one is worse, Guitar Center for deciding to sell to Bain, or Bain Capitol's practice to buy out troubled companies, make money off of them, then dump them. Either way, if they don't fix this quick, those of us in the industry might be looking at Wal Mart for that next set of speakers, amp, or drum kit. Yikes!

SUMMERTIME = MOTORCYCLES. 
The most common type of motorcycle accident is the "Left-turn Lucy." That is when a vehicle is waiting at an intersection waiting to make a left, then misjudges the oncoming motorcycle's speed, makes the left turn, and the motorcycle impacts the side of the vehicle. Judging the speed of anything coming straight at you is very difficult (motorcycle, train, your ex w/ a vengeance), so PLEASE be EXTRA careful when making left turns, especially if you see a motorcycle coming at you. Most of us don't have 9 lives like the guy in this video. This happened last month right here in the Tampa Bay area.

data.post: When I retired from the Air Force in 2011, I went through the VA and was extremely disappointed - it's a BROKEN system. Contrary to all the propaganda fed to us during our Retirement briefings like "It's not your Dad's VA," things are not much different. New buildings and facilities, same problem. Well, it seems things have only been getting worse since that time. I am in constant contact with Veterans at the college who DO use the VA system and it's rare to hear a 'good' story about the VA experience. Shame on Washington for keeping quiet on this issue, yet falling all over themselves looking for the nearest camera to push items on THEIR agenda. So far, under the current investigation, it has been found that 40 veterans DIED waiting for patient care, while some VAs altered waiting lists to make it appear patients were not on the waiting list as long as they actually were. Seems the only thing being 'doctored' at the VA are waiting lists.

Definition of the word HUMBLE:
1. Not proud or arrogant; modest: Example: to be humble although successful.
2. Having a feeling of insignificance, inferiority, subservience, etc.: Example: In the presence of so many world-famous writers I felt very humble.
3. Low in rank, importance, status, quality, etc.; lowly: Example: of humble origin; a humble home.
4. Courteously respectful: Example: In my humble opinion you are wrong.
5. Low in height, level, etc.; small in size: Example: a humble member of the galaxy.

data.post: To say Denver had an 'off day' would be a flat out lie...they got their a$$es beat...plain and simple. Now to answer the question, 'Which would you rather have, the #1 offense or the #1 defense?" My answer will always be, DEFENSE WINS CHAMPIONSHIPS! Congrats to the Seahawks. Well deserved.
Well, I certainly did not expect this. Wow Denver, I thought I was done watching underperforming teams when my Cowboys played their last game this season.  Geez!

BRUNO MARS owned it! An entertainer in EVERY sense of the word. RED HOT CHILI PEPPERS rocked it too! Now that's how you do a halftime show on the biggest stage in the world! Way to go Bruno Mars...you made your parent's home islands (Puerto Rico & the Philippines) very proud...and of course, the island that saw you grow up as well, Hawaii.

2nd quarter recap: Seattle's defense shows why they're the #1 defense in the NFL by intercepting/scoring. Broncos are struggling...no points. I don't think anyone would have predicted the Broncos would be scoreless at the half. Yikes! Ready for the halftime show: BRUNO MARS and the RED HOT CHILI PEPPERS.

1st quarter recap.  Game, so far, has been ho-hum. Seattle has appeared to dominate so far (been in red zone twice and scored a safety), but only have 8 pts to show for it. Score is 8-0 Seattle. On another note, favorite commercial so far is Radio Shack's throwback to the 80s.

comments.comment: @Ray - Those inter-division games in the NFC East are always exciting. Records go out the window and it's on! The rivalries within that division make for TV ratings heaven...primetime, next Sunday. As far as the 4th and goal situation, I wish it wouldn't come down to that (especially given Romo's record in Dec), but I was happy to see him make yet another play. With Romo, you get what you got out of Favre, a gunslinger w/ a short memory that's not afraid to take a chance...just wish he had better results in those situations. The kid CAN play, his setback is mental, not physical. IF he ever overcomes that, he'll retire with a couple of rings. But unfortunately for him, the clock of Father-Time is not on his side, he better figure it out quick...tick, tock...

Felicidades!

Semester over, grades posted, and evaluations complete...I (finally) earned my Associate's Degree at Hillsborough Community College (HCC). I say finally because it was quite a LONG break from when I started college right out of High School to after I retired from the Air Force (25+ years later). I suppose the correct term for students like me is "Adult Learners" or "Nontraditional Student." Either way, I got it done. Next up...I applied the Univ. of South Florida to earn my Bachelor's Degree. Wish me luck!
Saludos y Felicidades!

Anyone driving from L.A. to San Diego has seen this cross on top of Mt Soledad as you approach San Diego. I get the whole thing about displaying religious displays in public vs private land, but as they say, c'mon man! There has been a cross at that spot since 1913; it is a war memorial. Does it REALLY violate the Constitution's requirement for separation of church and state? Here in Florida, at a war memorial right off of I-4, there is a HUGE Confederate flag that flies high over the freeway. Many people have complained about it and some even consider it offensive and want it removed, but since it is on "private" land, it remains. Things that make you go hmmmmm...

Rios says Pacquiao's power didn't really affect him and that he didn't really feel it...or Mad Cows really reflected on an orange peel in...or... I couldn't really understand him cuz his lips were so swollen. Either way, Rios was all talk.

Pacquiao made good on his promise to punish Rios. Pacman completely out-boxed Rios tonight. He looked good. Lots of movement, combinations and power punches....Rios didn't have an answer. Unanimous victory for Pacqiao. Who's smiling now?
Pacquiao 11, Rios 0. Last round!
So far, Pacquiao in total control. 7 rounds to 0 in my book.
Rios keeps shaking his head No and smiling, which according to my boxing translator means "Yeah, you got me."
So far, Pacman up 4 rounds to 0. Rios is getting tagged. Pacman showing excellent movement. So far, Rios' weight advantage has NOT been a factor. Let's go Pacman!
Ok, Rios comes out to Eminem...Manny chose Katy Perry??? LOL! What is going on tonight?

There's no crying in boxing!! So far tonight, in one fight, a boxer refused to come out, and in the other fight the boxer cries on his trainer's shoulder after his trainer stopped the fight. What the heck is going on??!! This Pacquiao fight should be interesting.

Ready for Pacquiao vs Ruiz. 
Watching undercard fight Andy Ruiz Jr. vs. Tor Hamer...After taking a couple good hits, Hamer quits...refuses to come out of corner to fight. Really? 2nd time he does this in his "professional" career. As the announcer said, "Once you quit, it becomes easier the next time." Wow.
Saturday is finally here!! Isn't this what you've been waiting for? Now go do something fun! Have a great weekend everyone!!

data.post: Parts of the Philippines were devastated by the typhoon last week. Thousands of deaths and even as of today, some people still have no electricity or running water and little to no food, water, or medicine. It's as bad as it gets. Last night my wife and I (she is from the Philippines) watched a special report by Anderson Cooper (who is in the Philippines right now) and our hearts just sunk by what we saw. The stench of decomposing bodies they haven't located yet through all the debris is unbearable, mass graves, the process of family members attempting to identify their loved ones but were having difficulty because they were so badly decomposed, parents sleeping next to their deceased children....and on and on. It's devastating. My wife could only sit there and weep for her country. Can you imagine being in a foreign land watching on TV your homeland go through such devastation and heartbreak? Unfortunately, that's not the worst of it. We have also heard (and tried to ignore) the politics of that country being thrown in...are you serious? At a time like this? Politics has no place in these situations, but as we saw in our own country during 9/11 and Hurricane Katrina, some politicians are quick to take advantage of someone else's misfortune to attempt to garner support for their own, personal/political benefit. It's despicable. Remember that next time you cast your vote. On a brighter note, while watching the broadcast, I also saw something in that report that put a silver lining in the clouds. I saw resilience among the people. I saw families pull themselves together with whatever they had left. I even saw people smiling. My wife and I were there 2 years ago visiting her hometown, and we saw people living in what is known here in the U.S. as "third-world" conditions. Yet, people smiled, laughed, danced, sang, drank (Tanduay!) were family-oriented, and welcomed us into their homes w/ no shame and were happy to share what little they had with us. That was beautiful...they ARE beautiful. The Filipinos ARE beautiful people. My heart aches for my wife and for the Philippines today. Mabuhay ang Pilipinas!

media.description: Today, as I was walking out of the library, I noticed an elderly man walking w/ his walker, supported by his caretaker. He could've been wheeled around, but he wanted to walk. I was behind them. As I passed them and started putting on my motorcycle gear, I noticed he and I had something in common; the Hap Arnold Wings. He wore his on his hat and I wore mine on my helmet. So I just HAD to go back and ask, if he was in the military. He was...He was in the Army Air Corps...WW II veteran...retired Air Force...90 years old. He flew in C-46s and C-47s. We spoke for a bit and he was just as interested in me as I was in him. He asked me how long I was in, what my job was, etc...usual questions veterans ask each other. I was impressed by him. Independent as he possibly could be, sharp, funny, curious, caring... May God bless him and may God bless the rest of the Veterans who served this country honorably. Today, I met my brother from a different generation...pretty damn cool.

media.description: 'White-lining,' 'lane-splitting,' or 'lane-sharing' (or whatever they want to call it)...this looks like an open lane to me. In California (& Japan where I learned how to ride) this is legal and not as 'unsafe' as I know some of you are thinking. There's actually more room than you may think between cars. Difficult to sit in traffic while these 'lanes' are wide open after having used them for so many years. Definitely changes the riding experience. Different states, different laws...**sigh**

I can't believe it's come to this. Our elected officials in Washington ought to be ashamed they can't sit down to negotiate without threatening the livelihoods of those Americans who dedicated their adult lives to this country. This affects people like me directly. I am retired (Air Force)...check!...I receive a disability pension from the VA...check!...and I also receive Tuition Assistance (Post 9/11 GI Bill) to help me pay for college...check mate! I guess they got me. So much for  dedicating my life to a cause I believe in, be financially compensated for a service-related disability, and trying to re-enter the American workforce as an educated veteran. Geez!

data.post: Well boxing fans, Mayweather made another great boxer look average; he's that good. Canelo  is nowhere near Mayweather's level. The best man won...Money Mayweather.
Damn! Mayweather is taking Canelo to school. That's why I said Canelo's age is his only weakness;Mayweather is smarter. But MAyweather better stay smart...this kid is hungry!

data.post: I don't know if it's a generational gap thing, but do you remember when it was QUIET at the library? I remember going to the public library with my parents when I was probably about 5-6 yrs old and it was always quiet. Even through my years in the Air Force I always found the on-base libraries quiet. Now that I'm back in school after all these years, I have yet to find a quiet library. People talking on cell phones, listening to music on their headphones so loud that I have to put headphones on just so I don't hear them, people carrying on a conversation as if they were talking at the grocery store parking lot...geez! The ONLY refuge I've found is the "Quiet" or "Super Quiet" rooms available at some libraries. #perturbed

iPhone 5S w/ iOS 7 ...I'm ready for it! I have the iPhone 4 (not 4S) and it's the best phone I've had to date. It's easy to use, works seamlessly iCloud and iTunes, it takes fantastic pictures, durable (survived multiple drops w/ cracking glass), great battery life (I don't play games), easy to backup on my Macbook Pro, apps galore, ...and the list goes on and on for me. For me, it works. I don't need a 6.3" screen on a "portable" device. If I want a bigger screen than the phone I'm holding in my hand now, I'll get a tablet or iPad. For those of you that have been talking cell phone technology w/ me for a while, know that I was a HUGE fan of the Palm software with true multitasking, swiping cards, etc. The iOS7 brings that back to the table and I'm SUPER excited about it. If I could design a phone for ME, it would look exactly like the iPhone 5S running iOS7. Me happy :-D
iPhone 5s AND iOS7...YES PLEASE!
...and the Cowboys win. The end. Good night!

data.post: Talent is talent.

BEWARE OF CRAIGSLIST ADS. There are many scams all over the internet. I did not get scammed, but they sure tried ;-) Basically, I ran an ad offering Professional DJ Services on Craigslist. I received a response where we agreed to a price, but when I received my Retainer Fee (Deposit) in the mail, the amount was way over what we had agreed to ($1,560 over!). HERE'S THE SCAM PART: they apologized for the confusion saying the total amount I received was for the entire party, which included Emcee, Party Planner, DJ, etc. They asked me to deposit the check, take out my part, and send them the rest. YEAH RIGHT! That's the scam! I deposit a fake check, send them 'real' money from my bank account, and by the time the bank figures out the check is fake, they already have their 'real' money in hand and are out looking to do it all over again. I reported it to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and am waiting to hear back; there's a link conveniently located on the Craigslist website...guess it's a common occurrence. I'll keep you posted. SO BEWARE and remember what you've been hearing all your life...IF IT LOOKS TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE, IT PROBABLY IS.

Effective July 4, 2013, WTMP (96.1 FM) in Tampa FL switched formats from "Tropical" to "Regional Mexican" to accommodate a growing Mexican population primarily in the Central Florida area. Tropical format Bahia 1150 AM (which also used to broadcast on 96.1 FM simultaneously) will now only broadcast on AM 1150. People in the know, claim the FM signal was much stronger in rural Pasco and Hernando counties, where most of the Latino population is of Mexican descent, while the AM station's signal is stronger in the Tampa Bay/Hillsborough county area, which is more densely populated and also includes Latinos that prefer the Tropical format. :-/  My comment?: In radio, ratings are EVERYTHING!
www.MonteroMusic.com

data.post: Hi everyone! When I see "Happy" Memorial Day it makes me cringe. Not trying to split hairs here, but just would like to clarify something. "Memorial Day is a day for remembering and honoring military personnel who died in the service of their country, particularly those who died in battle or as a result of wounds sustained in battle."  Veteran's Day, on the other hand, "...is the day set aside to thank and honor ALL those who served honorably in the military â in wartime or peacetime."  On that note, THANK YOU to all the men and women that have served or are currently serving our great country. Say what you want, I'd rather live nowhere else in the world. Have a safe Memorial Day weekend everyone.
En casa 'chillin' escuchando a SaborSalsa.net. Saludos Adrian Treto El Salsiquico!!

MUSICIANS, think about this... "A prophet is honored everywhere except in his own hometown" (No hay profeta sin honra sino en su propia tierra). I heard this from my professor in Music Theory class last week (it's actually a biblical reference to Mark 6:4). For the sake of this post, replace the word 'prophet' with the word 'musician.' Don't know why, but apparently this isn't just an issue here in Central/South Florida!! LOL!! Have a safe Memorial Day weekend everyone.

GOOD MORNING!! Wow! What a GREAT ride it has been so far being able to play and sing with Salsa bands in Central/South Florida since I moved here 1 1/2 years ago!! Living the dream, baby!! I want to say THANK YOU to all the bands/bandleaders/bandmembers who trusted in me to do what I love to do, not only here in Central/South Florida, but also wherever I've been stationed and played like Los Angeles, Texas, and Okinawa, Japan. Well, like they say...NOTHING stays the same forever. I feel it's time for me to take the next step and move on to my SOLO project. It's been a dream of mine since I first grabbed a mic to sing on stage many moons ago. This process has actually been in the works for quite a while and now that I'm retired from the Air Force (after 22 years) and am finally settled here in beautiful Florida, IT'S TIME...IT'S MY TURN! I've been working with some of the best talent in the Salsa Music industry and already have a couple of original songs completed, and am currently working on a few more, and lately, I've been writing as well...I'm so excited! I've pulled out of all local projects (bands) I've been working on for now, while I go through this process. Of course,  I will keep my commitments on the DJ side of the house, as with HAWKRADIO and private events, and I will remain enrolled in college as a MUSIC major. Chasing my dream of recording my own album...'being a recording artist'...after that, who knows??!! Well, what better month to do it than during MILITARY APPRECIATION MONTH, right? Wish me luck! :-D  www.facebook.com/monteromusic

data.post: "One step at a time" ... "Keep chipping away" ... "Good things come to those who wait" ... "Success always comes when preparation meets opportunityâ ... "God helps those who help themselves" ... I have all of those (and MANY more) either written down on a sticky note, in my planner (Yes, Jim Werner, I still carry one), or etched in my memory somewhere to keep me going when pursuing my dreams gets tough. I've found through my experiences in life  that whatever you believe or do, you must continue to move forward, regardless of how much, as long as you're moving. It's tough...and there's no sugar-coating that. Sometimes you're tested by family members, close friends, people you don't even know and it can be demoralizing. Let's face it, if it were easy...everybody would be doing it. You really have to be committed and hold yourself accountable and you will move closer to achieving your dreams. If you need a break, take a break, but then get it going again...don't stop! Be relentless...it's YOUR life! Be smart...be great!

#1 Show in Puerto Rico for over 14 years is now OFF THE AIR. The show is a gossip show much like the show in the U.S., TMZ Live, where they dish out the latest and greatest 'bochinches' in PR. On one hand, these types of shows keep people in high power (i.e. celebrities, politicians) from pulling the wool over the public's eyes, but on the other hand, does the show take it too far?? Well, what's troublesome to me is that this type of program was #1...for 14 years!!! A puppet dressed in drag with a "girly-man" type of voice on a gossip show #1 in PR for 14 years...geez, what does that say about the people there? The show is off the air (for now) as a result of a boycott that led to TV executives to require the show to be taped in advance before airing...the creator of the show walked out. Are we better off? What do you think? QUE BOCHINCHE!!!

data.post: "If you could only imagine" said the cardboard sign a man was holding at the stop light. So I asked him what does it mean? He replied, "my circumstances, what put me out here and you in your car, what's in your future, what's in mine?" As he reached for the dollar I gave him I felt his hand was icy cold. Damn, a reminder for us not to judge w/o knowing what's really going on in someone's life. What if there was something YOU could do to help somebody out, no matter how small the gesture..."If you can only imagine."

What a great week overall! Started last week spending time w/ my Dad and brother (Luis) in Puerto Rico, then back to the U.S. and spend Thanksgiving w/ my family and other brother (Ricky) in Kissimmee, and a quick visit w/ my son, Ivan Jr. Then back to Tampa to perform w/ A&C La Banda, a little Christmas shopping...now time to relax and get ready for another week. Wow!!! Feeling truly blessed. On the other side of that coin, missing my "Big Little Bro" Javi, my sister Kayla, my girls Ashlee and Aleigh, my step-Dad Pucho, and of course, Mom...we're next!
@Shakira, Alanis Morisette called from 1995...she would like her act back now

This Thursday, 18 Oct 2012, are the 2012 Billboard MEXICAN MUSIC Awards. The program is in its second year and will be broadcast from the Shrine Auditorium in L.A. This genre accounts for 49% of ALL Latin Music shipments in the U.S. (RIAA, 2012). Acc to the U.S. Census Bureau (2010), 63% of Hispanic-origin people in the U.S are from Mexican background. 
QUESTIONS: 
(1) Do you think this divides the Hispanic community? 
(2) Should there be another Billboard Awards show for Latin Music besides the Billboard Latin Music Awards? 
(3) Should there be another Latin Music Awards show addressing the remaining genres (i.e. Tropical)? 
***Tune in tomorrow (www.HawkRadio.com) 12-1 (EDT), where I will discuss your comments. ***
Veteran Services at Hillsborough Community College (HCC). Do it! You've earned it! (now watch the video :-)

I was a 'featured veteran' in a commercial for the college I'm attending, Hillborough Community College (HCC). The ad reaches out to Veterans and Active Duty members and encourages them to utilize the benefits they have earned by signing up for classes at HCC, online or in the classroom, at any of their campuses. Enjoy, and yes, I was "Volun-told" to do it...thanks Magi. Just kidding, I was honored to do it and I DO believe in the power of Education. Here it is:

The threat to our country and our freedom is not imaginary. I am proud to have served this great nation on Active Duty for 22 years, just as my father, cousins, uncles, brother, and many more relatives before me, to do my small part to protect our freedom and our way of life. I believe in America...still. THANK YOU to all my brothers and sisters in the Armed Forces that I served with, and especially to those that continue to serve and protect us all. Thank you to our Police, Firefighters, EMTs, and ALL First Responders. May God bless you all. We will never forget...I will never forget.

Got the 'Green Light' to go ahead with my radio show on WMNF/HCC Radio here in Tampa. It's a college radio station that broadcasts on HD Radio and has a 'Live' stream over the internet. 
     Name of the program is "HCC Vellonera." The format is Tropical/Latin and the show's concept is a call-in (text, twitter, facebook, pigeon...) program where listeners call-in their requests, and if I have, I'll play it. Vellonera, of course is the Spanish word for Jukebox, so you never know what you'll hear! It's a fun/loose format perfect for college radio. 
     Today was the first show and it went pretty well considering the last time I was on-the-air was about 24 years ago when I was on College Radio at WPTS at the University of Pittsburgh. Super excited!
HCC Vellonera
Live!...from Ybor City...LOL...Tune in next week!
www.HawkRadio.com or 88.5 FM / HD4
Every Wednesday, 12PM-1PM

http://www.hccfl.edu/hawkradio.aspx

Most schools here in Tampa closed due to Tropical Storm Isaac. We had heavy rain at times and tornado warnings, but dodged most of it. Praying for New Orleans...storm is expected to develop into (at least) a Category 1 hurricane and make landfall Tuesday evening.

ATTN DJ's - Times Have Changed!
     DJ Salaries are on the rise, and STILL climbing! I'll spell it out so there's no question, "Bottom-Feeders" get the heck out of the way, "Pro DJs" if you are SERIOUS about making decent money out of playing music, push the bottom-feeders out of the way if they won't move, and go get PAID...remember the slogan, "Act like a Pro, Get Paid Like a Pro." Among other things I've managed to accomplish in my short lifetime ;-) , I've been spinning turntables since my high school days (mid 80s). I know you serious DJs can relate to this, but I am TIRED of not getting paid a fair rate in comparison, TIRED of bottom-feeders stagnating the DJ communities' salaries by undercutting each other, and TIRED of venues not paying DJs our fair share. 
     There is an international push where DJ's rates are gaining momentum. Granted, the format that is making the most money is the Electronic Dance Music, but even if you don't spin that type of music, take this opportunity to step our game up as a DJ community - wake up! There's always going to be scum out there that will undercut you to get that gig at an embarrassingly below-market rate and those that hire them...you can't do anything about them...that's something their mommy & daddy did to them. Worry about YOU. Be a professional and most importantly, bring it! Put on solid performances, please your crowds, work that bar...you know what you're doing. Now go get what's yours...I know I am. "Lead, follow, or get the hell out of the way!"   -IM

media.description:
LATIN TALK (Corpus Christi, TX)
Inducted to South Texas Music Walk of Fame
June, 2012

data.post: Super proud of my brother musicians in Corpus Christi, TX. Last week, the band I had the privilege of playing with for my brief stay (3 yrs) in Corpus Christi, LATIN TALK, was inducted into the South Texas Walk of Fame...they got their star! Mike, Jon, Gustavo, Jody, Glynn, and all those who accompanied us onstage...THANK YOU for allowing me to be a part of what you do. I am truly humbled. I have been on many stages before Latin Talk, but these guys...professionals...helped me take my game to the next level. They constantly pushed me to step outside of my comfort zone and dare to fail...dare to be better. Today, I can truly say I am a better musician because of them. They are forever etched in me as "Stars" for what they did for me, but now they are etched in the history of Corpus Christi/South Texas for what they've done for their city. To give you an idea of what this means, check out who they are now in company of: Selena, Freddie Martinez, Sr (Freddie Records), Freddy Fender, Flaco Jimenez, Kris Kristofferson, Christopher Cross, Jennifer Pena, "Beto" Garcia, Eddie Olivares, Sr, and so many others. Congratulations Latin Talk!

data.post:
*Great response from a musician about a club looking for free bands:
*Craigslist Ad:
*We are a small & casual restaurant in downtown Vancouver and we are looking for solo musicians to play in our restaurant to promote their work and sell their CD. This is not a daily job, but only for special events which will eventually turn into a nightly event if we get positive response. More Jazz, Rock, &... smooth type music, around the world and mixed cultural music. Are you interested to promote your work?
Please reply back ASAP.

Reply:
Happy new year! I am a musician with a big house looking for a
restaurateur to promote their restaurant and come to my house to make dinner for my friends and I. This is not a daily job, but only for special events which will eventually turn into a nightly event if we get positive response. More fine dining & exotic meals and mixed Ethnic Fusion cuisine.
Are you interested to promote your restaurant? Please reply back ASAP.*
Here we go 2012! New year, new city, new gig...Let's get busy!

What is a Veteran? A Veteran - whether active duty, discharged, retired, or reserve - is someone who, at one point in their life, wrote a blank check made payable to "The United States of America" for an amount of "up to, and including their life."

Happy Veteran's Day to all vets, all services. As we all know, freedom never comes free. I salute you all and am proud to have served beside my brothers and sisters in service for 22 years. God Bless America!

R.I.P. Heavy-D...another one gone way too soon! Great memories spinning his records when I was a DJ on WPTS in Pittsburgh in the late 80's and all the way in Okinawa, Japan in the mid-90's when I was spinning records on the military bases there. The "Overweight Lover!" R.I.P.
Walking w/ American Heart Assoc today - meeting at Bucs Stadium (Tampa, FL) @0900. See you there!

Here I am performing with Latin Swing (in Tampa)...I'm playing Bongo on this one. My boy, Valdy, is on Bass and singing lead on this one. Lisandra is accompanying him on vocals, and rounding out the percussion section on this one is Luis on Timbales, and Nelson on guira.
Rehearsal tomorrow w/ Latin Swing...getting ready for Orlando. :-)

Thanks to all that came out to support Orquesta Urbana last night. We enjoyed playing for you and can't wait to do it again. Special thanks to Tony and his better half, Diosi, for hanging out w/ Magi & I. And of course, a HUGE "GRACIAS!" to Freddie Cruz for the opportunity.
Rehearsals done, final preparations now. Ready for my debut w/ Orq Urbana tomorrow here in Tampa.

Rehearsal w/ Orq Urbana a couple of nights ago was HOT! Very talented group of guys. If you love Salsa and you'll be in the Tampa area, don't miss my debut w/ Orquesta Urbana next Friday, Oct 28, 2011. Copa Restaurant & Lounge, 4235 W. Waters Ave, Tampa FL 33614 starts at 9PM. See you there!
RIP Steve Jobs - you changed the world.

Special thanks to Latin American Motorcycle Association for hosting Latin Swing at their event last weekend in Sebring, FL. So many great looking bikes! Maybe next time, I'll ride mine in :) Evening Party was bangin' too. Congrats on all your success and ride safe...keep the shiny side up!
